loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Homoine Província de Inhambane tem 22 anos de idade vive maritalmente, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que se encontram em Inhambane enviando lhes dinheiro mensalmente.
Trabalha na empresa privada como despachante a 1 ano e é criador de frangos, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende erguer uma obra de residência e ser um empreendedor de sucesso. O seu maior desafio é continuar com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Raimundo was born in the Homoine Province of Inhambane. He's 22 years old and is responsible for supporting his parents in Inhambane, to whom he sends money every month.

He works in a private company as a courier and has been raising chickens for the last year - he uses the money he makes for household expenses. With this loan he plans to increase the volume of his chicken breeding business by buying chicks, ration and vitamins. This is his 2nd loan from Hluvuku.

In future he plans to build a house and be a successful entrepreneur. His biggest challenge is to continue with his studies.

loans.use: buy chicks, ration and vitamins for his chicken breeding business.

loans.name: Berthilde

texts.en:
Berthilde is 41 years old. She is married with four children; all of them go to school. Her husband is a mechanic, and she works in a shop. She has been working for the past ten years. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more plates, bananas and Irish potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to invest and save in the same business.

loans.use: To buy bananas, Irish potatoes and plates for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water tanks

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna has been running a farm for 20 years. She lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in Ayrum village of Lori region. Zhanna's only son is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, working hard to support his family financially. 

Currently, the family's only source of income is agriculture. They run a farm that includes cows, chickens and a pig. Zhanna also grows cherry trees and grapes and sells the harvest in the open market.
 
Zhanna decided to increase the number of her sheep by 10 and that's the reason of applying for this loan.

She asks Kiva lenders to support her loan of USD 1,200 and will be grateful to their support.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard lives in Qarakert village of Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband and two children (ages 8 and 4 years old). 

Her husband is currently working in an auto repair service, but he cannot even take care of their family's basic needs because of his low salary. To be able to survive, Nvard and her husband breed a livestock of cows and hens. They now need to buy some more hens to develop their agribusiness. 

A loan of 2,000 USD will be a great support to the family and will assist them. Nvard and her family will be very thankful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for five hens and 5 oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is a woman with a kind heart. She was born in the year 1982. Umeda is the careful mother of two little children.

Umeda's husband is a worker, but his income is not enough to improve their living conditions. So, Umeda decided to organize her own business. She is going to start a business in animal husbandry. Umeda hopes that her business is going to do well, and that she will make a good profit. 

Umeda is going to buy cattle feed some months and sell in a local market. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ through a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 550 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing her new business

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангез женщина с открытой душой, хорошая жена и заботливая мать. Ей 24 года. У нее один годовалый ребенок. Муж поневоле судьбы работает вдали от семьи, в Российской Федерации. Мехрангез живет с родителями мужа в районе Шахритус. Она у себя при дворе дома создала скотный двор и занимается животноводческим бизнесом. Мехрангез разводит скот уже три года. Теперь она думает увеличить поголовье скота, чтобы таким образом увеличить доход от продажи скотов. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита Мехрангез намерена купить крупнорогатый скот и продолжить деятельность. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Mehrangez is a woman with an open soul, good wife and caring mother. She is 24 years old. She has a year-old child. Her husband, a captive of fate, works far from the family, in the Russian Federation. Mehrangez lives with her husband's parents in the Shahrituz district. She created a livestock yard in her backyard and is involved in an animal husbandry business. Mehrangez has been raising livestock for three years already. Now she is thinking of increasing her livestock headcount in order to increase the income from selling livestock. Mehrangez intends to use the requested loan amount to buy cattle and continue her business. She hopes for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and continue her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the cow that suddenly died.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, rice, and green grams to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Muhayo works hard to support her family. She has a clothes sales business in Tajikistan. She has had this business for five years.

Muhayo has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from IMON International. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future she hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

Muhayo is asking for a loan to buy clothes for new season. In this way her business will improve, so that she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “To get ahead.”

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo arrived in the United States from Mexico 11 years ago and got a job at a small supermarket, where the owner quickly promoted him to a shift manager position. Two years later, Romulo became general manager for the store. He saw that his hard work was earning the company a lot of money, and he realized that he could own his own business.

“I thought that with hard work and with what I have learned as a general manager, I could be my own boss and make my own money for myself and my family,” he said. 

Romulo opened Salsas Mexican Grill last October in Haltom City, Texas. He said he and his wife chose to offer Mexican cuisine because that is what they know best, and because there weren’t many Mexican restaurants in the area.

“We’ve had many clients tell us that they were glad we opened where we did so they didn’t have to drive so far to get to a Mexican restaurant,” he said. “Plus, everything we serve is fresh – fresh tomatoes, fresh onions, fresh chili peppers, fresh meat, so we have lots of happy customers.” 

Salsas Mexican Grill seats up to 50 people and offers a traditional Tex-Mex breakfast, lunch and dinner menu six days a week.

His business is growing steadily, but Romulo wanted to make an investment so he could grow it more quickly. So, he turned to a bank for a loan so he could pay for advertising and buy more equipment, including a new grill. 

“The bank said I didn’t have enough of a credit history, and that they couldn’t take a risk on me,” he said. 

As luck would have it, Romulo was listening to the radio when he heard an advertisement about Accion Texas. So, he applied and was able to gain approval for his loan.

Opening a business is not easy, he said. 

“It takes a lot of patience and there are many issues to resolve, from paperwork and inspections to getting funding, but if you’re going to open a business, you cannot get discouraged,” Romulo said. 

“Fortunately, Accion Texas exists to help people who want to get their business started and move it forward, and the people there are willing to listen and help.”

loans.use: to pay for advertising and more equipment, including a new grill.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has successfully repaid her  loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for five years and she earns a good income. She sustains all her needs through her business and helps her family at the same time. She is determined to have a  better income.

To improve sales, Virginia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. She will use 20,000 PHP to purchase more quantities and varieties of groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She is appreciative and sincerely thanks you for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Virginia hopes that her business will continue to operate and help with every day expenditures. She desires for her and her husband to be strong and healthy. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and she can draws strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Asnatha

texts.en:
Asnatha is  a  44-year-old married woman with 4 children between the ages of  11 and 22. Three attend school. She has sold t-shirts and scats for the 20 years.

She will use the loan to buy more clothes. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine was born in 1976 and is a married mother of four. As a child, she enjoyed watching her mother sew and tried to tailor most of her dolls’ dresses.

Nisrine started a home-based tailoring business 20 years ago to help her husband (who has a limited salary) meet their four children's living expenses and needs. 

 Nisrine requests a Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy new bedroom furniture for her children in order to keep them living in a healthy environment.

She hopes to expand her work and open her own tailoring factory in the future.

loans.use: to buy new bedroom furniture for her children in order to keep them living in a healthy environment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the roof and expand the kitchen of his home.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as jovial. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are from the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

James will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy paint for his tuk tuk. His business goal is to own two more tuks tuks within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy paint for his tuk tuk

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old, widowed, and a mother of three children who are 20, 18, and 15 years old. She has been selling clothes for the last seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to add more stock of clothes for sale.

Susan will use the anticipated profit to provide for her family's basic needs and to grow her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as obedient. 

She operates a retail business to sell wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. 

Her biggest business challenge is a lack of finances. She will use 20,000 KES to buy sugar, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have increased profits within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a businessman and she sells food stuffs, which she has been doing for three years. 

Yvonne requested a loan, which she will use to buy vegetables to sell. She hopes to increase her business by 100%. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Llodia

texts.en:
llodia  is a 33-year-old married woman with  2 children who are 12 and 14 years old and attend school. 

She has sold salt, sugar, rice and beans for 2 years. She would like to buy sugar, rice and beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 29 years old and married with a 1-year-old child. 

She has sold grains for the past 10 years and would like to buy increase her inventory of rice, beans,and sugar. 

in the future, the profits from the business will be use to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe. Se dedica a la carpintería, como ser elaboración de muebles de madera de todo tipo como puertas, mesas, sillas, chineros, closet, etc. Este negocio lo tiene hace 12 años, el taller es propio y trabaja en su casa. Antes se dedicaba a la agricultura pero decidió por su oficio y a sido rentable.  El préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo y es por 18,000 lempiras, este mismo lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima, como ser madera, sellador, color, lijas, barniz, brochas etc. Para la elaboración de muebles y que no le falte nada para trabajar bien. Su plan es crear otros negocios para darles educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Gonzalo is 36-years old.  He is married, has three children and lives in a neighborhood of Taulabe.  Gonzalo makes his living as a carpenter; he makes all kinds of wood furniture like doors, tables, chairs, china cabinets, closets etc.  He has had this business for twelve years.  He owns his own workshop, which is in his home.  Previously, Gonzalo worked in agriculture, but he decided on this trade instead, and it has been profitable.  The loan Gonzalo is requesting is his 6th and is for 18,000 lempiras (USD $875).  He will invest it in the purchase of raw materials for making furniture, such as wood, caulk, paint, sandpaper, varnish, paintbrushes etc.  With these items, he will have everything he needs to do his work well.  Gonzalo's plan is to create other businesses to be able to give his children an education and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making furniture, such as wood, caulk, paint, sandpaper, varnish, paintbrushes etc.

loans.name: Aishapatma

texts.en:
Aishapatma is 46 years old and lives in the Gardabani district with her son who works at a factory in Turkey. 

Aishapatma was involved in a retail clothing business years ago. She is currently unemployed and wants to restart a business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 1500. She will use the loan to purchase clothes in Turkey and will resell them in the Gardabani district. 

She is experienced in this business and thinks that it will profitable. Aishapatma awaits your support.

loans.use: to restart her business and start trading clothes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 29 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, cuenta con casa propia en el distrito de Nanchoc en la provincia de San Miguel en la región de Cajamarca, sierra de Perú.

Gloria se dedica al comercio de animales de corral con varios años de experiencia en el negocio solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1000 nuevos soles los que invertirá en la compra de animales pequeños ya que luego de 2 meses incrementara sus ingresos con la venta de estos y así apoyar a su familia mejoarando sus calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 29 years old, is cohabiting, has 2 children and lives in her own home in the Nanchoc district of the San Miguel province, in the Cajamarca region in the Peruvian mountains. 

Gloria works selling corral animals and has several years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will invest in the purchase of small animals. She will sell these 2 months later to increase her earnings and in this way support her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals so that she has a greater variety.

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es: Don Eliodoro, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre con su pareja con quien  tiene 2 hijos y reside en el municipio de Taulabe. Se dedica a la producción de café, este negocio lo tiene hace 20 años, los productos que ofrece es el café en pergamino y lo vende a los intermediarios. Anteriormente se dedicaba a cultivar maíz y frijol. Ha solicitado 9 ciclos de préstamos con el actual que es por 8,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en los gastos de limpieza de la finca, y compra de abonos, esto le ayudara, a mejorar la finca y así tener mayor producción de café. Tiene pensado continuar con la siembra de ¾ de manzana para mejorar la situación con la familia.
texts.en:
Don Eliodoro is 59 years old and is in a common-law marriage with his partner, with whom he has 2 children. He lives in the Taulabe district, where he has worked in coffee production for 20 years. The product he offers is pergamino coffee, which he sells to brokers. Previously he worked growing corn and beans. 

He has applied for 9 loans, the current one being for 8,000 lempiras. He will invest this money in the cost of cleaning the plantation and buying manure. This will help him to improve the plantation and so have a better coffee production. He is thinking of continuing by sowing 3/4 of the land, to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to buy manure and cover the costs of cleaning his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is going to school. She has been selling clothes for the seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale in the future. The profits from the business will be used to become a supplier of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Faina

texts.en: Faina is 24 years old. She is married with one child who is three years old. Her husband is a driver. She sells clothes and she has been running a business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes, like trousers and shirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her business up to 90%.

loans.use: To buy more clothes like trousers, shorts and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to store his products and improve his inventory so he can pay for his son's university education.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens, age 41, is married with three children, two of whom go to school. He sells alcoholic drinks such as beer. With this loan, he would like to buy more drinks, such as beer, to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his family's house.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, such as beer, to sell.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak is a 33-year-old married woman with three dependent children who are enrolling in primary school. She lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. For the last five years, she and her husband have been managing a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. Her farmland was located just behind her house. The net profit that this couple can make is USD 7.00 a day.

Sak wants to improve the general living conditions of her family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy products needed to maintain it. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build and maintain sanitary latrine facilities

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, married to Celestine and blessed with two school-going children. He has been running an electronics repair shop and he has been in this business for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).
	 
He has applied for his second loan of 22,500 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more electronics spare parts for use in his shop.                                                                                           

Daniel will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and in future open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy more electronics spare parts to use

loans.name: Adeeb

texts.en:
Adeeb is a 29-year-old married Palestinian refugee, who works in and has lived in a Palestinian refugee camp since he was born.  He has worked in construction, specialized in plumbing,  for  twelve years.

Due to the weak economic situation in Lebanon, Adeeb’s income is not enough anymore to cover his expenses and needs, and he is working hard to develop his business, through expanding his working sector to nearby villages and cities. 

Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay what’s left from the price of the car he bought to use in transporting his business tools easily from one place to another.

loans.use: To pay the remainder of the price of the car he bought to use in transporting his business tools

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is requesting a new loan to buy food and household items to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and household items  to restock her general store.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc, 39, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a salesman. Cuc started a food stall ten years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food to to sell at her stall and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of food to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and two go to school. She operates a pub at the market. She serves all kinds of people in her pub. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She takes care of additional family members. 

Doreen works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO of 500,000 UGX to buy crates of beer, sodas and spirits. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of buying a fridge for her pub. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, sodas, and spirits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Irenea hopes to prosper in her business and that her children will complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is 29 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, infant son, and parents-in-law in a small village of the Khulo district. Tamila and her family are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 cows, whose milk is used to make cheese. In addition, they have 1.5 hectares of agricultural land, where they grow potatoes. The harvested potatoes and produced cheese are sold at local markets.

Tamila decided to open a shop near their house, and she requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to receive a loan of $3,000. With this credit, she will purchase all the stock she needs and will open a market. This will increase her monthly income. With increased income, Tamila will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase all the stock needed to open a market.

loans.name: Hoai's Group

texts.en:
Hoai is 36 years old and lives with two children and his wife.

For many years, Hoai has been repairing and selling old computers from his store to earn an income to support his family. He is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group who live in HCMC, Vietnam. In the picture, he is in the middle wearing a black shirt.

Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Hoai is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of used computers to repair and sell from his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. He also hopes that, through his loan, he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy old computers to repair and sell at his shop

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is aged 30 years old. He has been selling spare parts for vehicles for the past 8 years.

With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts to sell in future. The profits from the business will be used to increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married and has five children. To make a living, Gemma engages herself in the retailing of grocery items in their village. She has been managing her sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years.

Gemma wants to continue operating her business, where she generates income to sustain her family's needs. For this, she is borrowing additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy drinks, condiments, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Gemma hopes that her business will last and she will be able to increase her profits for the sustenance of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders! Meet Francis, who is 32 years of age, a hard worker and a very honest farmer. He hails from the rich Kisii highlands in Kenya; an area that has good rainfall patterns and is known for banana farming. There, a staple food is “ matoke” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. Francis has one child whom he adores and cherishes, and a beautiful wife who always paints a smile on Francis' face. 

Francis has been practicing mixed farming for the past six years and through all those years he has been making great strides. Through profits he has been able to earn a decent and honest living. Francis generates income through milk selling, egg selling and personal business. Through these ventures, he has been able to send his child to school and afford a plate of food. . 

Francis has planted many trees in his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. As a result of this, Francis has been making a lot of profits through milk-selling. The demand has really increased, and he cannot meet it. That is why he is requesting kindly for a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture and Francis wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Francis is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Also, food for his dairy cows will never be a problem because he has planted Napier grass. Through increased profits, Francis is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. 

Francis, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo through its training has helped Francis have a saving culture and through accumulated profits, he plans to add value to his milk through packaging. Also he hopes that one day he will start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a drill, a polishing machine, compressor and a soldering iron which will allow him to work in his workshop and to improve his and his parents' lives.

loans.name: Felicitee

texts.en: Felicitee, aged 31 years old, is married with three children aged between 10 and 13; all of them go to school. She has been selling items such as saucepans, plates, and spoons. With the loan, she would like to buy more  kitchen equipment. The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen equipment such as saucepans and  spoons for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a single young Palestinian refugee, born in 1995, who has worked in the construction domain, specialized in paint work, for three years. Just like most Palestinians, Ahmad has limited access to several working sectors in Lebanon. He left school from the elementary level and started working to cover his parents' financial needs.

Ahmad works independently; he was able with his persistence, strength, and ambition to increase his income, and cover his living expenses without any help.

Today, Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a necessary scaffold (iron pillars) that will facilitate his business and help him improve his business quality further. He is working hard to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a necessary scaffold that will facilitate his business

loans.name: Odeth

texts.en: Odeth is 49 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 20 and 22; both of them go to school. She has had a garage for 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for vehicles. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for vehicles for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, aged 35 years old, is married with three children, aged between 2 and 8. Two of them go to school. She has been selling telephones for eight years, and with the loan, she would like to buy more phones for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more phones for resale.

loans.name: Goldie

texts.en: Goldie is married and lives together with his family. He manages a farm and at the same time works in a private institution to make a living. He is borrowing a new loan at GDMPC micro-credit to cover the costs for house renovation. In the future, Goldie wants to provide his family a better living situation and he also wants to ensure a better source of income from his farm.

loans.use: to cover the costs of house renovation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 47 years old, and she is married with four children, aged between 12 and 22, all of whom go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, beans, cassava and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, beans, cassava and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 42 years old, and she is married with two children aged 12 and 18, both of whom go to school. She has been selling clothes for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella has been helping her husband operate their banana production for a living. With more than fifteen years in farming, her ability has improved, as well as her farm. It brings better income for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. To enhance the farm, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients. It is her dream to expand her cultivated farm to ensure a better source of income from their farm, which is their main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to legalize the home in which he lives.

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en:
Masitula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and two go to school. She operates a restaurant at the market, and she serves all kinds of people in her restaurant. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She takes care of additional family members.

Masitula gets additional income from selling piped water. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feeds and vaccines. Her major challenges include seasonality and diseases that affect the growth of her birds. She is aspiring of building rental houses. 

Masitula lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and vaccines

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 48 years old. She is married with four children. Three children go to school. 

She has been selling food for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans, sorghum, and millet to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans, sorghum, and millet to sell.

loans.name: Verena

texts.en:
Verena is 47 years old. She is married with four children. All of the children go to school. 

She has been selling food for the past year. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, beans, sugar, sorghum, and millet to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, sugar, sorghum, and millet to sell.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 59-year-old married mother of five who has worked as a tailor from her house since she was 28 years old.  Hoda is responsible for the living expenses of one member of her family in addition to her own living expenses. 

She is in her thirteenth loan cycle with Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to improve her business productivity through buying necessary tailoring tools and accessories. She will invest part of her loan to help her beloved husband pay for part of his travel expenses to see his parents. 

As for her future plans, Hoda is working hard to open a separate tailoring shop outside of her house which will provide her family and customers with preferable privacy.

loans.use: to improve her business productivity through buying necessary tailoring tools and accessories

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

Edwin operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. 

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to own a timber yard within five years. He hopes that he will be a successful businessman in the future.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina lives in the village Vostan of Ararat region.  She has no higher education, but she has become a very skilled and perfect tailor, thanks to her laborious character and her great desire to provide her children with better living conditions.  Now she works without holidays at a private workshop as a tailor, and simultaneously she does the same work at her house. She sews both for women and men, and also for children (dresses, skirts, pants and etc.).  She says despite getting very tired she is happy to have a lot of orders, and she is always ready to perform the desires of even her most whimsical clients. 

Marina lives with her mother-in-law and her two pretty daughters. Her husband is in the Russian Federation and works abroad. So together with her husband, Marina tries to cover her family’s minimum needs. 

But still one very important problem remains unsolved because of the lack of money.  Now Marina hopes that by getting this loan Kiva lenders will help her to start the repairing of their house, which has not been repaired for more than 20 years. She also wants to separate her workroom in order to work in better and more convenient conditions.

loans.use: to start repairing her house and to separate her workroom.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 37 years old. He is married to Caroline and together they have been blessed with three children. Dickson runs a retail shop, a business he has had for the last six years; he earns a monthly income of KES10,000. Dickson has requested a loan of KES45,000 which he will use to purchase products for his retail shop, including sugar, milk, bread, baking flour and other home products. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya; he successfully repaid his previous loan. With the anticipated profits, Dickson will be able to grow his business further. Dickson's hope and dream is to lead a happier life and run a flourishing business.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman and a mother of two grown children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store.

Elena is asking for a 10,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy additional stock for her store like canned goods, noodles, cookies, chips, candies, dried fish and others. With this, she will be able to augment her stock, thus attracting more buyers. She looks forward to making her business ever more successful.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 37 years old. Not yet married, he has no children, and he is a builder. He has been building houses for the past sixteen years. With the loan, he would like to buy cement, sand, soil, and iron sheets. He wishes to buy more items and improve his business so as to earn twice the profit. The additional income from the loan will be used to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, soil, and iron sheets

loans.name: Midus

texts.en:
Midus lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. She also takes care of additional family members (brothers daughter). She operates a kiosk at the market where she sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works for six days a week. 

Midus has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO of UGX 700,000 to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil and other kinds of juices. Her major challenges include high transportation costs and electricity, which increases the operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to own a fully stocked kiosk. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, cooking oil, soda, and eggs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a single lady, born in 1982. She is responsible for the expenses and needs of her family which consists of two members.

Six years ago, she opened her own clothes shop and she worked hard to succeed. 

Now, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released special seasonal clothes and dressy clothing, in addition to getting ready for the coming season.

Lina hopes that in the future she can own a big store and increase her income to save some profit for her future needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released special seasonal clothes and dressy clothing

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie lives with his parents. He is single and has been recently working at the cooperative in town. He earns a better income for his personal needs and is able to support his parents financially. 

His parents have a farm, but with their income, they cannot afford to repair their house. Ronie borrowed a new loan to finance the repair of their house. 

He wants to provide better living condition to his family in the future.

loans.use: to finance the repair of their house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is married and has two children. When asked, she described herself as determined.

For the past seven years Linet has owned a shop where she sells soap, sweets, flour and other items. Her shop is situated in a good location. A lack of capital to build her business is her major challenge.

This will be Linet’s first loan with SMEP Microfinance B. She is applying for 20,000 KES to augment her stocks of flour, soap and other items.

Linet’s business plan is to have a bigger retail shop in five years. She is working for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en: Leonie, aged 47, is married with two children, aged 16 and 19. Both of them go to school. Leonie has been selling items in a food market and with the loan, she would like to buy more items such as cakes, milk, and bread . The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cakes, milk, and bread for sale.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal, 33, is married with one child who is going to school. For the past five years he has been selling groceries to earn a living.

Pascal is applying for a 550,000 RWF through Urwego to buy more rice, sugar and soap to augment his stock. The profits from his business will be used to build his family a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en: La’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. La makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Ang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ang makes a living cultivating rice  to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vanna makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Sarun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sarun makes a living repairing electrical appliances and trading second hand clothes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en: Kong’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kong makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lida's Group

texts.en: Lida’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lida makes a living as a taxi driver and farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bien, born in 1977, is currently living with her husband and two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two children are all obedient and hard working. 
	The main income of her family is primarily based on breeding and cultivation.  Her family’s annual income is just enough to cover the family expense after deducting the investment cost.  However, each coffee crop requires additional fertilizer, this cost is quite large, and currently she cannot afford this fertilizer.
	Therefore, she needs to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for coffee and try to work hard to earn money to pay for M7-MFI on time. She hopes the loan will help to renovate her family’s land and to have money to invest in the coffee garden to bring better life for the whole family, especially for her children with better learning conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is single and she is working in a private company in order to make a living. She helped her parents by providing them a motorcycle used for transportation services. To improve the services she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy spare parts and other accessories. She is planning to build a store in their village to let her parents manage while she is working. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other accessories.

loans.name: Dúo Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
Dúo Milagro de Dios.
Este dúo esta conformado por la señora Lidia Leticia de 27 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica desde hace varios años, el sueñor de ella es llegar a tener un local donde poder vender su producto en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica por mayor asi pagara un precio mas economico por su producto en ropa tipica, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
“Milagro de Dios” (Miracle of God) Group

This group includes Sra. Lidia Leticia, age 27. She has been selling traditional clothes for several years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her products.

Lidia is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy traditional clothing at wholesale. As a result, she will be able to pay a cheaper price for her products. She hopes to receive assistance with this loan that she requested.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saing's Group

texts.en: Saing’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saing makes a living cultivating rice and his son also does extra work as a farm laborer to support the family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anichka

texts.en:
This pretty lady’s name is Anichka and she lives happily with her family in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She is 28 years old and already a mother of two frolicsome boys. Anichka graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Methodology and Pedagogy. Now she works at the school as a teacher of elementary classes (with 5-7 year old children). 

Of course she has only 5 years of pedagogical experience, but she is already a very respected and beloved teacher. She performs her lessons very attentively since her pupils are of the age that is very hard to keep listening during the whole lesson. So she organizes interactive lessons, discussions and kinds of games that include the themes of the lessons and helps the pupils learn and develop through games.  Anichka says this method of teaching is very typical for this age. She also has pupils for whom she prepares entrance examinations through private courses (Armenian Language and Literature) at her house. 

Anichka’s husband is unemployed now and he is looking for a job. Anichka asks for this loan in order to buy a computer and some professional methodological literature. She very interested in some new methods and any information that can help her to refresh her way of teaching and that can make her lessons more productive.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional methodological literature to make her lessons more productive.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta lives with her large family in the village of Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. She has three children, two daughters and a son. Unfortunately, two of her children, her son and elder daughter, are disabled. Her younger daughter is a weightlifter and takes part in many competitions.

For many years Marta’s husband has worked in the Russian Federation and from there sends financial support to his family. In her turn Marta contributes to the family’s income by working their farm. She has 45 cows, two calves, a heifer, five sheep and twenty chickens. All her farm goods she sells from home since she cannot leave her two disabled children even for an hour.

Marat is applying for a 150,000 AMD loan through Nor Horizon in order to buy medications for her disabled children that they must take periodically.

loans.use: to buy medications for her disabled children

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y  vive en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe. Se dedica al cultivo de café, este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años y es su fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia. Ella cuenta con un terreno propio y ofrece el café en pergamino y lo vende en la misma zona. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa. El préstamo que solicita es el octavo ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en resiembra de café, sustituyendo los arboles que se dañaron por plagas con el propósito de mejorar la finca y la cosecha. Su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Florinda is 46 years old, a single mother and has 3 children. They live in the municipality of Taulabe. She grows coffee and has run her business for 3 years. It is the main source of income for her family. She has her own land and she sells her product in her own locality, a coffee bean with the husk still on. Before, she sold clothing. The loan that she is asking for is her eighth and is for $975 which she will invest in replanting her crop. She will substitute the trees that have been damaged by plague with the hopes of improving her farm and her harvest. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and the education of her children.

loans.use: replant her coffee crop.

loans.name: Chanthoeun's Group

texts.en: Chanthoeun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanthoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Milton Humberto

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Milton desea montar un negocio de comidas rápidas en un local ubicado al frente de su casa en el municipio de La Dorada.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dio una amiga que lo impulsa y le enseña del negocio de comidas para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar junto con sus padres.
 
Aunque el siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como Microondas, sillas, mesas, parasol e ingredientes para sus preparaciones.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de un joven colombiano!
texts.en:
With the hope of being successful and getting ahead, Milton wants to start a fast food business in front of his home in the town of La Dorada. This idea stems from his friend who taught him about the food business, and motivated him to start his own business to generate enough income to support his household with his parents. 
 
Although he has always wanted to be independent, he never had the courage to risk starting a business; but now he feels he has the strength and ability to do so. 

He is requesting a loan to buy all the necessary items to start his business, such as a microwave, chairs, tables, a parasol, and ingredients for his meals. With these purchases he will be able to start this project and fulfill his dream of being independent. 

With the support of this loan you will be driving the entrepreneurial ideas of a young Colombian!

loans.use: to buy a microwave, chairs, tables, a parasol, and ingredients, which will allow him to start his business and fulfill his dream of being independent.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en: Leng’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Leng makes a living cultivating rice and fishing to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ren does work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Luong Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga, born in 1963, has been participating in the institution’s program since 1995. She currently lives with her husband and two children in Mai Son district.	
Her family's main income is from breeding, and it is just enough for food with a little remaining. She married late so now her two children are still at school age. Because of having to care for their education so she doesn’t have enough money to repair her house.
	Currently, she has only saved some of the amount to repair her house, which is why she needs to borrow money to make up for this cost. She will try to work hard to earn money to pay for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes the loan will help her family have a spacious and beautiful house.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Malay's Group

texts.en: Malay’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Malay makes a living trading groceries from home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sy's Group

texts.en: Sy’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jeaninne

texts.en: Jeaninne is 25 years old. She is married with one child who is 6 years old and goes to school. Her husband is a businessman. She has sold foodstuffs for six years.  With the loan, she will buy beans, rice, cooking oil, and Irish potatoes to sell.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for her child and to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cooking oil, and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Makao

texts.en:
Makao is a 49-year-old man, married to Mary who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with six children. Makao has been a livestock farmer for ten years earning himself an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.
 
He is now servicing his third loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount to buy additional cattle to sell to his customers.  Makao plans to use the profits he earns to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Kimsreang's Group

texts.en: Kimsreang’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kimsreang makes a living selling groceries from home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bertha Lydia

texts.es:
Bertha, es soltera, tiene una hija de 28 años; se dedica vender hot dogs y gelatinas, su desventaja es que la venta la hace de forma ambulante y tiene que hacer largos recorridos,  manifiesta que su mayor ventaja es que no tiene competencia.
El préstamo le será de utilidad para comprar pan, embutidos, aderezos, etc., de esta manera podrá elaborar la venta,  espera aumentar sus ventas, ganancias y su capacidad de pago, espera resarcir su deuda sin problemas y tener mejor calidad de vida.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y mantenerse trabajando para subsistir.
texts.en:
Bertha is single and has a 28-year-old daughter. She sells hot dogs and gelatins. Her disadvantage is that she sells as a street vendor, so she has to make long trips. Bertha says that her greatest advantage is that she has no competition.

This loan will be used to buy bread, sausages, seasonings, and other supplies in order to prepare the food that she sells. Bertha hopes to increase her sales, her earnings, and her payment capacity. She hopes to repay her debt without any problems and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, seasonings, and other supplies.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en: Seng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Seng makes a living cultivating rice, fishing and doing extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee, 53, has been selling beans, sorghum, cassavas and millet for the past ten years. She is applying for a 300,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more of these foods to sell. The profits from her sales will be used to improve the family’s welfare and increase their savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum, cassavas and millet to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has two children ages 2 years and 6 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates an M-Pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a safe place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more M-Pesa float i.e. money for customers to transact. Her business goal is to expand more and have more outlets within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add more M-Pesa float, i.e money for customers to transact.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 34 years old, and she is married with three children, aged between 3 and 11. Two of them go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, rice, cooking oil and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She states that her biggest business challenge is price fluctuation.

Lorna will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose, 56, is married and has three children aged between eighteen and 24 years. For the past six years she has sold charcoal to earn an income.

Daphrose is applying for a 275,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a married mother of five, born in 1967. She is a Palestinian refugee, who lives and works in a Palestinian Refugee’s Camp. She has lived there since she was born. 

Ten years ago, because of her husband’s limited income from working as a special events photographer inside the camp, she decided to help him to increase their income and cover their living expenses and needs.

Raeda learned this profession from her husband, and she was able to increase the family’s income properly to plan for her children’s future. 

Now, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to prepare for her son’s wedding and pay for the requested expenses. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to prepare for her son’s wedding and pay for the requested expenses.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is age 32, and he is married without children. His wife is a business lady and he has been doing transport for the past seven years. With loan, he would like to buy spares parts for a motorcycle and diesel. The profits of the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy spares parts for a motorcycle and diesel.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is 35 years old. She is married with three children aged between 11 and 2 years. Two of them go to school. Her husband works in a shop and she has been running a business for the past nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, beans, Irish potatoes and bananas for sale. The profit from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, beans, Irish potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Maritza Arely

texts.es:
Maritza una joven de 27 años de edad, muy dedicada y responsable estudiante de medicina de la universidad nacional, se crecio con su madre quien le inculco buenos principios y practicas las que la han llevado a salir adelante.

Se dedica a realizar sus estudios de fisioterapia de lunes a viernes en la universidad, y los días libres se dedica trabajar en una clínica fisioterapéutica, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que cuenta con un excelente historial de crédito ya que gracias a los financiamientos ha podido salir adelante con sus estudios, los cuales han sido pagados gracias al apoyo de sus dos hermanos que se encuentran en estados unidos.

La joven tiene una experiencia de 3 años en la realización de fisioterapias, ya que mientras se encontraba realizando su segundo año de estudio tuvo la oportunidad de un trabajo de medio tiempo, en una clínica que se encuentra en su municipio, y ya lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad. La cual le ha servido para satisfacer las necesidades de su estudio y solventar con los compromisos crediticios.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para pagar sus gastos de graduación y en compra de equipo y tratamientos para la obesidad, ya que ha comenzado a montar su propia clínica de fisioterapia, en la cual pretende poner a disposición de sus servicios, lo cual le generara un ingreso mas ya que atenderá 3 días por semana, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana menor quien ya es graduada de enfermera.  

Las proyecciones que la joven tiene para un futuro son las de ampliar su clínica de manera que pueda prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pagar y adquirir un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de equipo y tratamiento para sus clientes y apoyar en la reconstrucción de la vivienda de sus padres.
texts.en:
Maritza is a young woman who is 27 years of age. She is a dedicated and responsible student who is studying medicine at the national university. Maritza grew up with her mother, who instilled good principles and practices into her so that she could get ahead.

Maritza attends her physiotherapy classes Monday through Friday at the university. On her off days, she works at a physiotherapy clinic. Maritza is a hardworking and responsible individual who has an excellent credit history. Thanks to the loans she took out, she was able to move forward with her studies. She has been able to repay them thanks to the support she gets from her two siblings who are in the United States.

This young woman has three years of work experience in physiotherapy. While she is pursuing her second year of studies, Maritza is taking the opportunity to work at a part-time job at a clinic in her town. She has been at this job for three years and it has helped her to cover her studies and her financial commitments.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to pay her graduation expenses, as well as purchase equipment and obesity treatments. She plans to establish her own physiotherapy clinic where she can offer her services. This will help her to generate more income since she will work there three days a week. She will have the help of her younger sister, who graduated as a nurse.

The future goals of this young woman include expanding her clinic so that she can provide better service to her patients, acquire another loan so that she can buy equipment and treatments for her patients, and help with the reconstruction of her parents’ house.

loans.use: to pay her graduation expenses, as well as purchase equipment and obesity treatments for her new clinic.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is married and has four children ranging in age from two to twelve years. When asked, she described herself as honest.

For the past five years Carolyne has owned a shop from which she sells a variety of bags, shoes and other items to regular customers. Insecurity regarding sales is her biggest business concern.

Carolyne took out and successfully repaid three previous through SMEP. She is now applying for a 100,000 KES loan to augment her shop’s stock. When asked, she says her business goal is for her shop to be the best it can be within five years.

Carolyne is working to raise her family’s living standards. Her immediate plan for her profits is to buy a dairy cow for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, bags and other items

loans.name: Alinatha

texts.en: Alinatha is 48 years old. She is married with five children aged between 24 and 10 years old. She sells food stuffs, and she has spent five years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as bananas, sweet potatoes, beans and Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bananas, sweet potatoes, beans and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Sanavbarkhon

texts.en: Sanavbarkhon is a young and hardworking woman. She is not married. Sanavbarkhon began her own business at age 16. She is a sewer and services the local people. She sews national women’s dresses. She tries to sew dresses with new fashion. Sanavbarkhon has worked in this field more than three years. She has her regular clients, thanks to her good service. She needs an embroidery machine, because many of her clients inquire about making embroidery to their dresses. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be hardworking and visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. 

His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have improved living standards of his family. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Maria Danelia

texts.es: Maria Danelia mayor de edad casada con tres hijos independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, Maria Danelia es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación una minipulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, productos congelados(pollo, carne de res, carne de cerdo), bolis, paletas, gaseosas, juegos, queso, entre otros mas al igual que tambien destaza cerdos semanal y vende los deliciosos nacatamales, pepenas, frito, moronga, charrasca entre otros derivados mas, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, la rutina de Maria es salir a las comunidades aledañas a comprar cerdos al mejor precio para la futura venta, negocio el cual lo inicia con fondos propios hace mas de diecinueve años con capital propio y el cual ha sido una fuente trabajo donde le ha ayudado a mejorar los ingresos de su hogar, ha trabajado con león 2000 y ha demostrado siempre ser buena paga en tiempo y forma, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta, ya que se lo están dando a buen precio y en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, productos congelados, gaseosas, entre otros, Maria Danelia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Maria Danelia is a married adult with three grown children. She is from on of the municipalities of Chinandega, in the western part of the country. It is an area characterized by being commercially productive with some of the most ingenuity in the country. Maria Danelia is a micro-businesswoman who has a mini store in her house where she sells home consumption products such as basic grains, frozen products (chicken, beef, pork), popsicles, sodas, juices, cheese, and more. She also butchers pigs weekly and sells delicious nacatamales, pepenas, frito, moronga sausage, charrasca and other pork products. Her sales are in cash and she has regular and occasional customers. Maria's routine is to go to the nearby communities to buy pigs at a better price for future sales. She started this business with her own funds. She has been working for more than 19 years and has her own capital. Her work has been a source of work and has helped improve the household income. She has worked with León 2000 and has shown her self to be reliable with her payments. The purpose of this new loan is to invest in working capital and buy a lot of live pigs to raise and sell. She is getting them at a good price. She will also buy household consumption products such as basic grains, frozen products, sodas and more. Maria Danelia is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of low income and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy  lot of live pigs to raise and sell. She will also buy home consumption products such as basic grains, frozen products and more.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 22 years old and unmarried. For the past year she has sold various crafted items such as bags and baskets.

Annet is applying for a 275,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more of these crafted items to sell. She plans to reinvest her profits in the business and looks to building a better future for herself.

loans.use: to buy more crafted bags and baskets to sell.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 32 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 13 and 9 years, four of them go to school. She sells food and she has been in this business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more items like bananas, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, beans, rice and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more items like bananas, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, beans, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 60 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, sin hijos a su carg o, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el caserío de Macuaco en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, este caserío es una zona rural en ella se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza y venta de animales.

Emilio se dedica a la criáza y venta de animales de corral con varios años de experiencia en el rubro, solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1000 nuevos soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de animales pequeños para luego obtener mayores resultado con la venta de estos y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio is 60-years old. He is married and has no dependent children.
