He has his own home in the village of Macuaco, which is in Oyotun District, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region and on the northern coast of Perú. His village is in a rural area. The people there make their livings in agriculture and raising and selling animals.

Emilio makes his living raising and selling barnyard animals. He has a number of years of experience in this line of work. Emilio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles (USD $375), which he will invest in the purchase of small animals. He will have a better income with the additional animals and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.  The investment will allow him to have a greater diversity of animals, which will have a large impact on his business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is aged 49 years. She is married with five children aged between 18 and six years; all of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and she has been in the business for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and beans for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Puerto Salgar desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación y venta de arepas asadas por encargo. 

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Mercedes y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Mercedes desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su asador de arepas que está en mal estado, compra de mesas, sillas e ingredientes de trabajo como harina.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y mejorar su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo para su negocio!
texts.en:
Mercedes is a modest and hardworking woman who has dedicated a huge part of her life to caring for her children.  She lives in the municipality of Puerto Salgar, which is where she does spectacular work in the kitchen, as her business is preparing and selling grilled arepas to order.  

She mainly sells her food to neighbors in the area who know Mercedes' seasoning and know that they will always get delicious, well-prepared foods.  

Mercedes wants to increase her food sales and she wants to work more comfortably, which is why she is requesting a loan to repair an arepa grill that is in bad shape, and buy tables, chairs, and work ingredients such as flour.  

This loan will allow her to get her business ahead so she can make the income she needs to keep supporting her family and improving her business.  

Support this woman with a loan for her business!

loans.use: to repair her grill and to buy chairs, tables, and ingredients for her arepas, such as flour, to get her family and her business ahead.

loans.name: Rudy Wilian

texts.es: Rudy, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive actualmente con sus padres, en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe. Se dedica a la producción de caña de azúcar desde hace 2 años. Esta producción la vende en los ingenios azucareros. El préstamo que solicita es por 3,500 Lempiras el cual lo invertirá en mantenimiento del cultivo de caña para mejorar la producción. Su meta es que la cosecha sea de calidad.
texts.en: Rudy is 20 years old, single, has no children, and currently lives with his parents in a small town in the municipality of Taulabe.  He has been growing sugar cane for two years.  He sells his produce to sugar factories.  The loan he is requesting is for 3,500 lempiras and he will invest it in his sugar cane crop to improve his yield.  His goal is for his harvest to be of good quality.

loans.use: to maintain his sugar cane crop

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en: This is Jane. Jane is a small scale farmer in Kiambu, Kenya, where she practices horticulture farming. Jane is married with three children. She has been running a salon in a local market center to supplement the farming income. She now intends to concentrate on farming to increase her yields hence income to support her family. With a loan from Kiva, Jane will increase returns from her farm, have more time for the family and raise a happier family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Phylis Wanjiru

texts.en: This is Phyllis. She is a small scale farmer in Kiambu, Kenya. Phyllis has been operating a village hotel business which she has closed to concentrate on farming. She was struggling to make ends meet until she started the farming business two years ago. In her farming activities, she has seen her income grow and is confident of better life with the growth of her farming activities. She is now able to take good care of the family and attend to the farming business. With a loan from Kiva, she will improve her income and adequately take care of her family and educate her two children.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farming, buy inputs and increase income to support her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional new fashion shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, cuenta con casa propia en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la Región de Lambayeque en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura; crianza y venta de animales y al comercio en general esta zona es rural.

Luis se dedica a la venta de animales de corral con varios años de experiencia en el negoci, solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 800 nuevos soles los que invertirá en la compra de animales pequeños y luego de dos meses incrementar sus ingresos, por consecuenta sus ganancias y asi mejorará la calidad de vida de el y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old; he is in a relationship, has three children, and has his own home in the district of Oyotun in Chiclayo Province in the region of Lambayeque.  In this district people work in farming, raising and selling animals, and general commerce.  This is a rural area.  

Luis sells ranch animals for a living and he has several years of experience in the business.  He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 nuevos soles that he will invest in purchasing small animals and after two months his income, along with his profits, will increase, which will improve his quality of life and that of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, which investment will provide him with a greater variety of animals and more productivity, which will significantly influence his business.

loans.name: Nasibullo

texts.ru:
Насибулло очень жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат  и имеет на иждевении двоих детей. Сам он работает электриком на местном заводе. Он и его жена всегда мечтали дать своим детям достойное образование и стараются делать всё возможное чтобы их дети этого достигли и стали образованными людьми. Его жена работает в швейном цеху и получает от этого дела небольшой доход. 

Сейчас другой старший сын Насибулло закончил среднюю школу и хочет поступить в медицинский колледж. После окончания этого колледжа он мечтает стать хорошим доктором и помогать людям.После поступления в колледж они  должны оплатить обучение за первый год его обучения там. Но у Насибулло на сегодня не имеется такой большой суммы, чтобы сразу заплатить. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, когда узнал что есть возможность получить кредит на оплату образования. Насибулло  желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своего сына. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Nasibullo is a cheerful and hardworking man, aged 48. He is married, has two dependent children, and works as an electrician at a local factory. His wife works in a sewing shop and earns a small income. He and his wife have always dreamed of giving their children a decent education and try their best to make sure their children grow up to be educated people. 

Now Nasibullo's eldest son has finished high school and wants to apply to the medical college. He dreams of becoming a good doctor and helping people. The family will need to pay for the first year of his tuition, but Nasibullo does not have such a large sum of money available immediately. This is why he applied for a loan with Arvand when he learned that it was possible to get a loan to pay for education costs. Nasibullo wants to take out a loan to pay for his son's education. He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña carolina es una mujer que ha decidido salir adelante con su mini pulpería y venta de nacatamales,  ella cuenta con mucha experiencia en el negocio ya que era su mama la que hacía antes los nacatamales pero luego por su edad le dejo el negocio, su mama ha sido de gran apoyo y le ha enseñado todo lo que sabe hasta el día de hoy.
Ella necesita el crédito para la compra de insumos que utiliza para la elaboración de nacatamales tales como: Masa de maíz, tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, carne entre otros. Este crédito le ayudara ya que podrá realizar una mayor cantidad de nacatamales y obtener mayores ganancias. Dentro de su meta próxima esta hacer más grande su pulpería y abastecerla con más productos.
texts.en:
Carolina is a woman who has decided to get ahead with her minimart and nacatamales sales.  She has a lot of experience in the business as her mom was the one who used to make nacatamales, but she left the business because of her age.  Her mom has been very supportive and she has taught her everything she knows today.  

She needs a loan to buy supplies she uses to make nacatamales, such as corn masa, tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, and meat, among others.  This loan will help her as she will be able to make a greater quantity of nacatamales and make more income.  Her next goal is to make her market bigger and to stock it with more products.

loans.use: to buy supplies she uses to make nacatamales, such as corn masa, tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, and meat, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work supplies to improve her business and pay for her education

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yadira del Carmen Mayor de edad madera soltera de seis hijos los cuales todos aun están bajo su responsabilidad, de originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Yadira se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, ademas es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de comedor ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece variedades platos de comida corriente y a la carta y los fines de semana realiza deliciosas sopas de gallinas con albóndigas, res con punche y mondongos al igual que una deliciosa carne en baho, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos entre otros, sus compras las realiza en mercados y distribuidoras de Chinandega, las cuales son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus ventas son al contado, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para tener listo el desayuno luego el almuerzo y la cena, y no esperar a que sus clientes estén en espera por probar su deliciosas comidas, inicia su negocio como un medio de poder sacar adelante a sus hijos como madre soltera, y tener un ingreso para su hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos todos en unos profesionales, mejorar su vivienda y que su negocio pueda crecer mas y de esa forma tener en un futuro no muy lejano mejores ingresos, por lo que hoy en día esta nuevamente solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de materia prima para la realización de sus deliciosas comidas como: arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, frutas, sal, gaseosas, carnes( pollo, cerdos, res), bananos, leña, entre otros mas, para ofrecer variedades de comida y el brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Yadira agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Yadira del Carmen is an older woman and the single mother of six children who are still her dependents.  She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is in the western part of the country.  Yadira is known for being an enterprising, responsible woman who has a great desire to better herself.  Additionally, she is a small business owner and operator of a restaurant located in her home where she sells a variety of common dishes a la carte, and on the weekends she makes delicious chicken soup with meatballs, beef with crab and tripe, and delicious beef with yucca, natural soft drinks, sodas, and juices, among others.  She does her buying in the markets and bulk distributors of Chinandega, which are cash-only.  She has regular and occasional customers and her sales are in cash.  She starts her day very early so she can have breakfast ready, followed by lunch and dinner, so her customers will not be waiting to try her delicious food.  She started her business as a way of getting her children ahead as a single mother and having income for her household.  One of her dreams is to be able to see her children become professionals, to improve her home, and to expand her business more so that in the not-so-distant- future she will have better income.  For these reasons, she is requesting another loan to invest in working capital to buy raw material to make her delicious dishes, such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, fruit, salt, sodas, meat (chicken, pork, beef), bananas, and firewood, among others, so she can offer different dishes and provide her customers with better service.  Yadira is very thankful for the support Kiva's lenders offer to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as rice, sugar, oil, firewood, meat (chicken, beef, pork), sodas, juices, and fruit, among other ingredients to make her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 300 chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pedal pump and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia tiene 23 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene un hijo a su cargo, cuenta con casa propia en el caserío Alumbral en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, este lugar es una zona rural; en ella la población se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de animales de corral.

Romelia es comerciante, criá y vende animales de corral tales como patos, gallinas y cuyes; solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto es de 2000 nuevos soles, los que invertirá en el mejoramiento de los corrales de sus animales y de esa manera otorgar otra calidad de crianza a sus animales para que al momento de venderlo los pueda hacer a un mejor precio, lo que aumentaran sus ingresos, al igual que sus ganancias y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Romelia is 23 years old, married, and has a son. She owns her house in the village of Alumbral, Oyotun District, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's north coast. It's a rural area where the local people farm and raise animals.

Romelia runs a business raising and selling animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. She is seeking a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so she can improve the pens where the animals are kept. This improved environment will mean that she can get a better price for the animals when she sells them. Then her income will increase as will profits so she will be able to provide a better standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: Improve the pens where the animals are kept so they have better living conditions.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens, age 35, is married with one child who is one. Valens works in a shop and he has been running a business for the past year. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more items such as rice, sugar, coking oil, and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar, coking oil, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Grupo Palo Gordo Group

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Suchitepéquez está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Es la labor que realiza doña Maria de 23 años de edad que desde su casa ella sale con esa actitud de vender la mercadería con la que ella cuenta para tener un ingreso económico para su familia. (Maria es la que se encuentra en la 1ra de la fila de derecha a izquierda)

La actividad que ella dignamente realiza con todo empeño y dedicación es la venta de ropa, esa actividad lo realiza en el mercado de su comunidad ella ha venido realizando esta actividad durante 3 años, fue su primera venta la que la motivo a seguir hacia adelante y no dejarse vencer por los obstáculos que en el camino se presenten.

El uso respectivo que doña Maria le dará al crédito es para la compra de más mercadería,  para tener a la disposición de las personas más ropas para su respectiva venta ya que a ella le deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar su condición de vida en un futuro.

Doña Maria se a convertido en un claro ejemplo en su comunidad,  que si uno toma la iniciativa de poder llegar a ser alguien importante en la vida la pude lograr siempre y cuando realizando un esfuerzo, es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se a juntado con ella par emprender las actividades que los llevara hacia el éxito. Una de las aspiraciones de ella es mejor sus ventas y construir casas para darles a sus hijos una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It's a very hot day, and Suchitepéquez’s main market is filled with people coming and going, some buyers, and others selling. Hope dances between the two groups. Maria is 23 years old, and travels from her home to the market to sell merchandise in order to generate income for her family. (Maria is the furthest one on the right, in the picture).

Maria makes a hardworking, and earnest living selling clothes in her town market, which she has been doing for 3 years. Her first sale motivated her to continue on, to overcome the obstacles along the way. 

Maria will use the loan to buy more merchandise, so that her customers will have a bigger selection. This business gives Maria good income to improve her living conditions in the future. 

Maria has become a good example in her community, that if you take the initiative to become someone important in life, you will achieve it with dedication and effort. This is why a group of women have come together with her to learn how to achieve success. One of her goals is to increase sales and build houses to give her children a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children ages between 7 and 12 years; all of them go to school. Her husband is a policeman. Jeanne works in a shop and she has been running a business for the past 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy rice, sugar, soda, beans and cassava flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, soda, beans and cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Faroizkhon

texts.en: Faroizkhon is a kind woman. This is her second loan from IMON. Her first loan was a start-up loan and she began her own business. She opened a beauty salon where she also has wedding dresses for rent. Little by little, Faroizkhon develops her business. Her wedding salon is located in the center of her region. Many fiancées choose her salon because she offers fashionable wedding dresses. Faroizkhon is married and brings up 2 children. She always strives for the well-being of her family. She is going to increase working capital and develop business. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy wedding dresses for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for increasing working capital

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Patria Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal  “Virgen de Carmen de patria”, el poblado de Patria está ubicado dentro del distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
La socia Marleny, tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera, la socia  es una persona responsable y amable, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura y crianza de animales, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de madera, venta de cereales, ganadería, crianza de animales y agricultura.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the Virgen de Carmen de Patria Community Bank. Patria is located in the district of Kosñipata, Paucartambo Province, in the department of Cusco. She is 32 years old and single. She is a responsible, friendly person who works in agriculture and raises and sells animals in addition to her regular household chores. She has raised animals for a long time, and the business is going well thanks to her hard work. Marleny wishes to keep working so she can make progress in life. She is seeking a loan to buy manure, seeds etc.

The group is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan and promise to make their various repayments according to the established schedule. The other members of the group sell wood, sell grain, raise livestock, raise animals, and farm.

loans.use: Buy manure, seeds etc.

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru:
Абдугаффор жизнерадостный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 33 лет. Он женат  и имеет четверых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй он живёт в сельской местности. Сам Абдугаффор работает в местной мастерской сапожником, делает ремонт обуви. А его жена является домохозяйкой, она воспитывает детей. Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую они получают, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. Поэтому Абдугаффор имеет дополнительный бизнес. Он работает мастером по ремонту домов. 

В данное время Абдугаффор вместе со своей женой хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Абдугаффор обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdugaffor is a cheerful and responsible man.  He is 33 years old and married with four children.  He lives with his family in a village and he works in a local shoe repair shop.  His wife is a homemaker who looks after the children.  Abdugaffor and his wife love their children very much and they try to give everything from their heart because they want their children to have a good upbringing.  However, their income is not enough to cover all of the family's needs, which is why Abdugaffor has started a side business as a handyman (repairing homes).

At the moment, Abdugaffor and his wife want to make repairs to their home so they can improve their living conditions, but they don't have enough money for this project.  This is why he has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy building materials to repair his home.  He is hoping for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Martha es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

Ella prepara y vende comidas como pasteles, empanadas y tamales en el municipio de La Dorada, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, adicionalmente, desea iniciar con la venta de lechona que es una comida típica de la región.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de una olla grande, insumos y materia prima para sus preparaciones como harina, verduras pollo, entre otros.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes y mejorara sus ventas con el nuevo producto.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Martha's perseverance and enthusiasm, her household will now be able to have some additional income.  She makes and sells dishes like "pasteles" [savory pastry], empanadas, and tamales in the town of La Dorada.  She started the job in an effort to find additional income to support her family.  She also wants to start selling "lechona," a traditional [pork] dish in the region.

Her husband and children are her biggest motivation for working every day and making a daily effort to improve.

She hopes to be able to motivate her business with the purchase of a large pot, supplies, and ingredients for her dishes, such as flour, vegetables, chicken, and so on.  With these things she'll be able to have her food available for her customers, and her sales will improve with the new product.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area so she doesn't lose her customers.

loans.use: to buy a large pot, supplies, and ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es:
Olga es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, reformas de ropa y arreglos prestando el servicio a clientes directos.

Todo comenzó hace más de 8 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y por medio de la practica y su trabajo aprendió este oficio; hoy en día, a sus 42 años de edad trabaja fuertemente para sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles una buena educación, trabaja todos los días en horario de 6:00 am a 9:00 Pm; de esta forma intenta generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una motocicleta para acortar el tiempo de entrega de sus trabajos a sus clientes, adicionalmente necesita comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilo, botones, encajes, entre otros, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Olga sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Olga is the owner of a small business. She is very dedicated and hard-working. Her field of specialization is dressmaking, alterations, and tailoring. She works for direct clients. Everything started 8 years ago, when she was an employee in a dressmaking shop. She learnt this job through years of practice.

Nowadays, she is 42 years old and she works hard to support her children, and to be able to offer them a good education. She works everyday from
 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. This is how she tries to make enough money to help her husband with the family expenses.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a motorcycle, so she can deliver faster to her clients. She also needs to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, buttons, and lace among others. This is how she'll be able to satisfy her clients' requests and to deliver the orders in a timely manner. Her goal is to increase the production, and to get new contracts so she can keep working in her small business. 

Olga's dream is to strengthen her shop, and to increase the production every day, so she can create job opportunities. She also wishes to improve her family's life and also the lives of the people who collaborate daily with their work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, and to buy supplies such as fabrics, threads, lace, and buttoms among others for her dressmaking business to improve her production and her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Damacline

texts.en: Damacline is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more maize. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a married mother of four. She is a Palestinian refugee, who was born in 1959. Due to her family’s weak financial situation, her husband travelled abroad seeking a better income to become able to cover their living expenses and needs.

Six years ago, Ibtisam decided to sell clothes from her house in a way to help her husband in covering her family’s needs, and in order not to deprive her children of anything they need. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly offered fashionable clothes, especially for the summer season, and she needs to buy a new refrigerator for her house.

Ibtisam hopes she would open her own clothes-selling shop in the future and save some profit for her children.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 36 years old, married and has three children, ages 9 to 18. All of them go to school. Her husband has a garage where he is a mechanic. She is a decorator for weddings and helps to dress the brides. With the loan, she wishes to buy more clothes and flowers to sell. The profit from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy clothes, flowers to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rosalia

texts.es:
María tiene 68 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, la cual queda en una comunidad grande, en la zona rural de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales tales como patos, pavos y cuyes, desde hace más de 15 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in her own house. It is located in a large community in the rural area of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, which is on the north coast of Perú. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors.

She makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs. Her business is more than 15 years old and is located at her home. She is requesting a loan to buy animals and feed to raise them. In this way, her business will grow and she will generate more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 36 years old, married and has five children, ages 1 to 14. Four children go to school. His wife sells food stuffs and he sells flowers. Ibrahim has been running a business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy different flowers to sell.The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy different flowers to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 38-year-old woman married to Leonard and they are blessed with three children. Eunice operates a  butcher shop and a restaurant as a secondary business which has been in operation for 10 years, earning her an income of KES 50,000 every month.

Eunice was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 100,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy cattle for slaughter to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Eunice plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy cattle for slaughter to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 45 years old, married and has one child, age 8, who goes to school. Her husband is a broker and she has been selling greens for the past three years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more food like vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy food like vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 60 years old, married and has two children ages 29 and 24 years old. His wife is a farmer. He sells arts and crafts and has spent 44 years in business. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as clothes. He wishes to expand his business to the extent of doubling it. The profits will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her mother. Together with her mother, Lilit has been involved in a retail business. They trade in clothing in neighbouring villages to earn income for their living. 

The requested loan is very important for Lilit to be able to enlarge clothing supplies to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that this loan will strongly help her to increase her sales volume and asks lenders for their support. Lilit's  loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to resell

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy foods to sell from her food stall and to pay school fees for her children. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers and send her children to school. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy foods to sell from her food stall and to pay school fees

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for selling from her general store.

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es: Nelson, tiene 25 años de edad, está en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y  vive con su familia en el municipio de Jesús de Otoro cerca de Taulabe. Se dedica a la producción del  café, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años como su cultivo propio. La producción la vende en la misma zona. El  préstamo es su segundo ciclo y es por 19,000  lempiras en forma grupal, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y lograr sacar mejor cosecha y ganancias. Su objetivo es mejorar los ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. El grupo se llama Concepción, esta integrado por dos personas, que se dedican al cultivo de café y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 19,000 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café. En la foto esta Nelson a la Izquierda y Tiofilo a la derecha.
texts.en: Nelson is 25 years old, lives with his life partner with whom he has two children in the municipality of Jesus de Otoro, close to Taulabe.  He works in the production of coffee, he has been doing this activity for 5 years on his own.  He sells his product in the same area. The loan is his second cycle and is for 19,000 HNL for the group.  This money will be used to purchase fertilizer to maintain his coffee plantation and obtain more production and profits.  His objective is to improve income to get his family ahead.  The name of the group is Concepcion and it’s formed by two members, they both work in the production of coffee and live in the same community.  The group loan is for 19,000 HNL to maintain their coffee plantation.  In the photo Nelson is the one in the left and Tiofilo the one in the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain their coffee plantation.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
VANESSA NOEMI, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un pequeño niño de 12 años de edad. Vanessa Noemí pertenece al grupo "Las Amigas" formado por siete socias, Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, tiene aproximadamente tres años dedicándose a éste negocio, le ha ido bien pero ella sobretodo aprovecha y tiene mayor ganancia al comprar los productos en oferta y así poder contar con un stock de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así lograr una venta mas rápida.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como lápiz labiales, esmaltes, lápices, etc.
texts.en:
Vanessa Noemí, 23, has a young son, 12.

Vanessa Noemí belongs to Las Amigas Group, made up of seven members, and earns a living making catalogue sales of beauty products.  She has worked in this business for about three years.  It has gone well for her, but she has has made the most of it.  She earns more profit when she buys products on sale.  That way she can have a supply of products to sell to her customers and make a quicker sale.

She'll invest the loan in buying cosmetics such as lip pencil, nail polish, lipstick, and so on.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Jair

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 32 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, el socio a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento del carro.
El socio se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the 'Nueva Esperanza de Patria' communal bank. The bank is located in the Kosñipata district, in the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco.

The borrower is 32 years old. He has a spouse and 2 children. The borrower divides his time between his daily activities and providing transportation services. He has been in business for some time and it is going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into it everyday. The borrower also works in agriculture. He is a responsible and diligent person. He hopes to keep working in this manner so he can continue to support his family.

The borrower is requesting a loan to have car maintenance done. He is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam would like to take a further loan to buy a larger stock of shoes and slippers to sell from her shop. 

Tam's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of slippers and shoes for selling.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Victoria tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, la socia  es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono entre otros.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Victoria, belongs to Nueva Esperanza de Patria Communal Bank, located in the district of Kosñipata in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.

Victoria's 43 years old and lives with her companion, and she has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the agriculture business.  She has been in this business for some time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She also raises small animals.

Victoria's a responsible and diligent person.  She wants to be able to keep on working and helping her family.

She's requesting the loan to buy soil amendments and other supplies.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and other supplies

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy is 51 years old and has a son and a daughter. Her husband is a tailor. For the past three years, Thuy has been running a business of making wax pencils to sell to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a nine-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the second from left wearing a yellow and black blouse. 

Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Thuy is requesting a loan to purchase better quality materials to produce better wax pencils. 

She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce wax pencils.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man, born in 1989, who has an elementary-level of education. Five years ago he started working as a truck driver to cover his family’s living expenses and needs. His family consists of three other people.

Omar worked hard and he succeeded in saving some income to buy a car. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to register it and maintain it, since it is very important for his transportation to work.
 
He hopes to own a truck which will help him start his own business, increase his income and saving profit for his future.

loans.use: To register and maintain his car, since it is very important as his transportation to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food, chairs and other supplies needed for her cafe.

loans.name: Lisper

texts.en: Lisper is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cereals, tomatoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more sugar, cereals, flour and other items to stock her business. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more sugar, cereals, flour and other items

loans.name: Eudomila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Eudomila  tiene 23 años de edad es soltera  y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia cría a sus animalito para luego venderlos a usa clientes que le solicitan, la socia  es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos y animales.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Eudomila, belongs to Nueva Esperanza de Patria Communal Bank, located in the district of Kosñipata in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.

Eudomila's 23 years old and single, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising animals.  She has worked in this business for a long time, and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She raises her little animals to then sell to her customers on request.

She's a responsible and diligent person.  She wants to keep on working and helping her family.

Eudomila's requesting the loan to buy feed and animals.

She's grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy feed and animals

loans.name: Ngon

texts.en:
Ngon, 50, is single and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business 20 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products  to restock her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of products such as food and soft drinks

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc, 37, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including a daughter and his wife, who has supported the family by making clothes. He has earned money through a business of making plastic laminating for 7 years. 

Duc would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of material to increase his sales. He hopes his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of materials to make plastic laminating.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as food and beverages, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. 

His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. 

He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store, increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages

loans.name: Hakima

texts.ru:
Хакима жизнерадостная и доброжелательная женщина в возрасте 43 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Хакима очень любит свою семью, в особенности своих детей. Она старается со своим мужем трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать деньги на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи. Она хочет, чтобы её дети получили хорошее образование и стали образованными людьми. 

Сама Хакима занимается купле продажей женской одежды. От этого бизнеса она получает стабильный доход.  Муж Хакимы вместе с сыном работают в местном цеху по изготовлению окон и дверей. Они также приносят в дом доход. Но сейчас старший сын Хакимы хочет поехать к своему родственнику в Россию, чтобы помогать работать вместе с ним и зарабатывать больше денег. Для этого ему нужно купить билет и всё необходимое для поездки. Поэтому Хакима обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку билета для своего сына. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hakima is a cheerful and friendly woman. She is 43, married, and has five children. She loves her family and especially her children. She and her husband try hard to earn money to meet their family's needs. She wants her children to receive a good education.

Hakima buys and sells women's clothing and receives a steady income from her business. Her husband and their son work at a local shop making windows and doors. They also bring home earnings. Hakima's oldest son wants to go to his relatives in Russia to work and earn more money. To do this, he needs to buy a plane ticket and supplies for the trip. Hakima has applied for a loan with Arvand to buy a plane ticket for her son. She hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her son

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina is from Spitak town. Her only son works at Yerevan town as a constructor and from time to time supports his mother financially. Alina herself has been involved in a ticket-selling business. She owns a small house in the center of Spitak town where she trades airline and frequent flyer tickets. Over years of hard work, Alina was able to gain a collaboration with several airlines and frequent flyer agencies. In order to enlarge her office and provide better service to her clients she has applied for this loan. Alina needs more funds to be able to purchase a printing machine, a computer, and a scanner needed for her office. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for working capital (printing machine, computer, scanner)

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Wilter operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of financing. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add M-pesa float. Her business goal is to have a big M-pesa outlet within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add a M-pesa float

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Verónica  tiene 21 años de edad es soltera  y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia  es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono ,semillas entre otros.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Nueva Esperanza de Patria communal bank.  The bank is located in the Kosñipata district in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department.  Verónica is 21 years old, single, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities by working in agriculture.  She has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into the business every day.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She wishes to be able to continue working so that she will continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, among other things.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives in Vanadzor town with her 21-year-old son: Aren. Her husband left his country with the hope of finding a well paid job and supporting his family's living. Hranush's second son is currently serving in the army.

In order to cover daily costs, Hranush started her retail business three years ago. She sells clothing in the nearby village of Vanadzor town, and gets income for the family. 

The requested loan is highly important for Hranush to be able to purchase a new stock of clothing for her customers. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 56, has been doing a business making shoes for the past four years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is running her business with the support of her husband, and makes enough to provide the basic necessities for her four children including food, health and clothing. 

It’s her fourth loan cycle. She applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market. She wishes to spend part of the revenue that she makes on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business selling fruits for the past three years. She is very enthusiastic in her business of selling fruits and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, Mumtaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of apples, mangos, and guavas. This will help her to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangos, and guavas.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Carina tiene 29 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de agricultura ,la socia vende frutas a sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono y semillas.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carina is a member of the Nueva Esperanza De Patria community bank. The bank is situated in the district of Kosñipata, of the Paucartambo province and Cusco department. She is 29 years old, has a partner, and three children. 

Carina alternates her daily activities and works in agriculture, selling fruit to her various potential clients. She has been in this business for some time and it is going well, thanks to the efforts she puts into it every day. She is a responsible, hard-working person and wants to be able to continue working, thereby continuing to support her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is grateful for the credit provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
FLORENTINA, tiene 38 años de edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "Madres Emprendedoras" grupo está formado por cinco socios.
Desde hace 20 años Florentina inició su negocio de venta de comida, empezó colocando una mesita afuera de su casa ofreciendo pocos platos de comida, poco a poco y gracias a su buena sazón, fue aumentando su clientela ya que los mismo clientes la recomendaban a sus conocidos. Actualmente ha implementado un espacio en su casa para poder atender cómodamente a sus clientes ofreciéndoles diversos platos de comida, refrescos, postres, no sólo ofrece almuerzo además a agregado desayunos y en algunas ocasiones cena.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de la comida, a ella le conviene comprar los productos en cantidad ya que le cuesta a menor precio y le da un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Florentina is 38 years old. She is part of the group “Entrepreneurial Mother” formed by five members. 20 years ago Florentina started her business of selling food, she started with a table outside her house offering a few dishes, little by little thanks to her good skills, she increased her clientele through word of mouth.  She now has a bigger space in her house to comfortably serve her customers offering different dishes, pop, dessert, not only does she offer lunch but she has also added breakfast to it and in some occasions dinner.
The loan will be invested in buying ingredients to prepare food, it is convenient for her to buy products in larger quantities as they are cheaper and it allows her to make a larger profit margin.

loans.use: to  buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es separada, tiene cuatro hijos, tiene casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primario. Sobrevive dedicandose a vender comida en diferentes ferias 
El crédito lo requiere para comprar harina, queso y abastecerse de gas para preparar llauchas (llaucha es una empanada que se hace principalmente en La Paz y tiene gran aceptación)  en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ingresos. Teodora es la unicaf fuente de ingresos en su hogar y no quiere que sus hijos trabajen, prefiere que se dediquen al colegio, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Teodora is separated and has four children. She lives in her own house in El Alto.  She completed her Primary school studies. She works selling food at different markets. She needs the loan to buy flour, cheeses, and a supply of gas to prepare llauches (which is a type of empanada made principally in La Paz and well-liked) in large quantity to improve her income. Teodora is the only source of income in her house and she doesn't want her children to work. She prefers them to study so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese and gas to prepare empanadas.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Barbara tiene 59 años de edad es viuda  y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, la socia  es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar abono y semillas.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Barbara belongs to the "NUEVA ESPERANZA DE PATRIA" communal bank which is located in the Kosñipata District, Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco.

Barbara is 59 years old and has one child. She mixes her daily activities with her agriculture business. She has been in this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She also raises small animals. She is a responsible and determined person. She wants to be able to continue working in this way to go on supporting her family. Barbara is requesting a loan to buy manure and seeds. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the established payments.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to tend her coffee supplies.

loans.name: Isai Pablo

texts.es:
ISAI PABLO, tiene 19 años de edad, es estudiante universitario de la carrera de Ingeniería Pesquera, ya tiene año y medio de estudios, por el momento no trabaja ya que se está dedicando completamente a sus estudios ya que es una carrera que necesita dedicación. 
Isai Pablo, desearía llevar cursos complementarios a sus carrera pero aun no lo puede realizar ya que en la universidad tiene clases casi todo el día, pero hará un esfuerzo para poder llevar el curso de inglés, el cual será un requisito indispensable mas adelante al solicitar su título.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de mensualidades de la universidad del tercer ciclo de estudios.
texts.en:
Isai Pablo is 19 years old and is a university student studying Marine Engineering. He has been studying for a year and a half and right now is not working as he wants to dedicate himself completely to his studies. It is a course that demands dedication.

Isai Pablo wants to take some courses to complement his studies but up to now hasn't been able to as he has classes pretty well all day. But he will make an effort to take an English course, which will be a indispensable requirement when he goes to graduate. He will invest the loan paying the monthly installments of the university in his third cycle of studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his Marine Engineering courses.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат 45-летняя местная жительница района Шахритус, которая как и многие жители этого района занимается животноводством. Адолат начала этот бизнес всего год назад с поддержкой мужа. Сыновья тоже помогают матери в купле, откорме и продаже скотов. У Адолат трое сыновей. То есть животноводство у них семейный бизнес и единственный источник дохода. Поэтому Адолат хочет расширить бизнес и увеличить поголовье скотов. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Кредит поможет ей улучшить экономическое положение семьи.
texts.en: Adolat is 45 and lives in the Shahrituz district. She raises livestock, like many residents of the area do. She started her business just a year ago with help from her husband. She has three sons who help her to purchase, fatten, and sell the cattle. Raising livestock is the family business and their only source of income. Adolat wants to expand the business and have more livestock. This is why she is requesting a loan, which will help her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle and expand her livestock business

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remelyn is 35 years old and all of her children are in school.

Remelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Remelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Remelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Remelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 33 year old woman married to her husband Peter who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with two children. Florence operates a local money transfer business shop acting as an M-PESA agent for a period of ten years earning an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Florence was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 30,000. She intends to use the entire amount to add some cash flow to her money transfer business shop to boost the business cash flow. Florence plans to use the anticipated income to add stationery items to her shop which are in demand at the moment and hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to add some cash flow to her local money transfer business shop.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 30-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has two buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has four children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She uses most of the income to pay for her children’s health and education. It is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en: Rahat, age 45, is a married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling for the last 10 years. She has one buffalo and sells milk to many of her neighbors. She performs the task of collecting milk from it, and sells it at different places on a daily basis. In this way she obtains decent profits. She uses the income to support her family. She has four children. In order to make more profit, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes that this loan will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman and she has seven children. She describes herself as ambitious. Monica operates a retail business where she sells pots. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as financial problems. 

Monica will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more pots. She hopes that in the future she will have more businesses. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more pots

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be the best within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 43 years old and he lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and he lives with his wife (who works as a teacher at a school), his mother (who works at the kindergarten), his daughter (who is a student), and his son (who works at a private workshop delivering candies). For many years Artak worked as an accountant, but now he works a driver. Two years ago, Artak unfortunately had a heart attack and this caused very serious and great damage to his health and entirely changed his way and rhythm of living. 

Aratk hopes to have this Kiva loan in an amount of 250.000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his regular course of treatment which he passes periodically after that bad incident that life gave him so unexpectedly.

loans.use: to pay for his regular course of treatment after a bad incident (heart attack).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ramziya

texts.en:
Ramziya is a married mother of two. She is a Palestinian refugee born in 1980, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.  Due to the social and financial situation of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, Ramziya decided to work beside her husband in his grocery shop to improve and increase their income.

Today, Ramziya is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to add to her merchandise with new special offer products that will increase her sales and income at the same time. She hopes to expand her shop and save some profit to plan a better future for her children.

loans.use: To add to her merchandise with new special offer products that will increase her sales and income at the same time.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious and dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be the largest supplier of food stuffs within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine sends her greetings from Ijevan, a nice city, to all the generous Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon. She is already impatient to get her fifth Kiva loan. Karine successfully repaid all of her four previous loans according to her schedule. She still runs her clothes trading business. Karine sells children's, men's, and women's clothes, shoes, and slippers. She works at the clothes wholesale market in Ijevan city at a rented stall and and brings the products for sale from Yerevan in a rented car. Karine says her business has been very profitable for her family for the past 20 years and she has covered many costs for her family, including her daughters’ education, wedding parties, repair of her house, etc.

Karine again wants to gain profit from her business with the help of a Kiva loan. She has asked for this loan in order to buy a new assortment of fall clothes and also children's clothes for the beginning of the new semester of school.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of fall clothes and also children's clothes for the beginning of the new semester of school

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is a married woman. She describes herself to be self-committed. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 57-year-old woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son who is also shown in the photo. They have gained years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She needs to earn more money to bear her household expenses. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, tea, and juices to meet the increasing demand at her store. Sakina is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, tea, and juices.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling cloth for the last two years.  She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. Nasreen dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Умеда жизнерадостная и ответственная девушка в возрасте 22 лет. Она родилась и живёт в небольшом посёлке. Умеда пока не замужем. Живёт Умеда вместе со своими родителями в небольшом домике. Сама Умеда не имеет высшего образования, после окончания школы у неё не было возможности поступить в университет по финансовым проблемам в семье. И на сегодня она работает на местном рынке продавцом и получает небольшой доход. 

Также отец Умеды работает на центральном рынке, там он продаёт сухофрукты. Сейчас Умеда обратилась в Арванд для получения кредита на потребительскую нужду. Сейчас Умеда со своими родителями обустраивают свой дом, в котором они живут, чтобы им было комфортно там жить. Она хочет закупить комфортную мебель в дом. Но у них сейчас не достаточно средств, чтобы закупить сразу всю мебель по оптовой цене. Поэтому Умеда обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Umeda is a responsible, cheerful woman, aged 22. She was born and lives in a small village. She is not yet married and lives with her parents in a small house. She does not have a higher education and did not have the opportunity to go to college after high school because of her family's financial problems. She currently sells goods at the local market and earns a small income. Umeda's father also works at the central market, where he sells dried fruits. Umeda has applied for a consumer loan with Arvand. She and her family are improving their house so that they can comfortably live in it. She wants to buy comfortable furniture for the house, but they do not have enough money to buy the furniture at bulk prices. Umeda has applied for a loan with Arvard to purchase furniture. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela invested in her flower business and payed her first loan on time, now she is asking for a second loan to continue investing in her business, she si focused on making her business grow and spending time with her family. She is conscious of the importance on paying her loans on time and improving her credit score.
texts.en: Marcela invested in her flower business and payed her first loan on time. Now she is asking for a second loan to continue investing in her business.
