She is focused on making her business grow and spending time with her family. She is conscious of the importance of paying her loans on time and improving her credit score.

loans.use: to buy a variety of flowers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 40-year-old married woman. A year ago she started a general store in her community. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. Victoria wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy a stock of grocery items along with detergents and soaps in large quantities to meet the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of grocery items along with detergents and soaps in large quantities.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Hello! Ibrahim, from Suneka a remote village in the rich highland of Kisii, is an active and progressive farmer of his locality. He has a wife and four children and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops and personal business and he has been practicing farming for the past 30 years. Having done farming for such a long time he has gained so much experience and he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Ibrahim wants to take advantage of the market,  therefore he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Ibrahim has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. Ibrahim always says that, “to become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers”. He has planted so many trees on his farm that dairy food will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan he will not only benefit from milk but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm,  saving money that would have been spent in buying fertilizer.

Ibrahim has been facing challenges in accessing finances but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Ibrahim chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Ibrahim underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and during the training season, he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions.

Through accumulated profits he plans to permanently improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. He plans that through increased income he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is married to Katana and together they have been blessed with ten children. Agnes sells charcoal, a business she has done for the last 18 years, earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. 
 
Agnes has requested her second loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000, which she will use to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business even further by purchasing additional sacks.

Agnes' hopes and dreams for the future include educating her children and having a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 36 years old. She is married and has one three-year-old child. Her husband is a soldier and she works in a shop. Claudette spends nine months in her business.

With this loan, Claudette would like to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as strong and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular ones. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy and financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as aluminum, reinforcing rods, corrugated sheets, glass, and steel, in order to step-up his business and to continue working

loans.name: Marta Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha una mujer de admirar ya que durante su vida tuvo muchos problemas y dificultades de las cuales cualquier persona se hubiera doblegado y he aquí su historia.
Martha es una mujer que atravesó un difícil divorcio del cual quedo a cargo de 3 hijos y a eso se le sumo que quedo desempleada. 
Desesperada y muy preocupada por la situación comenzó a vender mercancía puerta a puerta por recomendación y ayuda de una amiga que la vio en pésimas condiciones y con muchos problemas. 
Gracias a esta labor la cual ejerce con excelente voluntad y disposición logro levantar el hogar y renacer en medio de tantos problemas. 
Hoy en día la vida le sonríe después de mucho tiempo y gracias a un crédito que puede solicitar lograra montar un local comercial  y aprovechar los más de 20 años de experiencia que tiene en la labor. 
El crédito le permitirá iniciar formalmente su negocio comprara estantería, arriendo del local, y mercancía en ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman to admire given that during her life she had many problems and difficulties because of which any other person would have given up.  Here is her story.
Martha is a woman who got through a difficult divorce from which she was left in charge of three children and added to this she was left unemployed.
Desperate and very worried by the situation, she began to sell merchandise door to door on the recommendation and help of a friend who saw her in terrible condition and with many problems.
Thanks to this work which she carried out with good will and an excellent disposition, she was able raise up the home and revive in the middle of such problems.
Today life smiles on her after a long time and thanks to a loan which she can request she will be able to initiate a commercial location and take advantage of her more than 20 years of experience which she has in this work.
The loan will allow her to formally begin her business and she will buy shelving, rent a spot, and purchase footwear and clothing merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shelves and display cases and pay the rent for a space and for the footwear and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en: Nvard is a teacher with 10 years of teaching experience. Besides her work in a local school, Nvard also provides lessons to students from her house. She lives together with her husband and 22-year-old son. Nvard is requesting a loan to buy a PC and a printing machine needed for her classes. She needs this loan to be able to provide efficient and fruitful classes to her students. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a PC and printing machine.

loans.name: Maria Patricia

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 32 años de edad, que desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades. 

Actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.

El negocio lo tiene hace 1 año, trabaja todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y, a pesar de la competencia que existe en el sector, ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos para que a su esposo y su hijo no les haga falta nada.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor, adicionalmente necesita sacar los registros de cámara y comercio para poder trabajar en el sector.

Maria, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, la impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a su hijo
texts.en:
Maria is a 32-year-old woman who has worked at different jobs since finishing her secondary school studies. She currently has a grocery store which was given to her by a family member so that she could run it and generate income to cover household expenses. 

She has had the business for one year and she works every day from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. Despite the competition in this sector, she has done quite well, generating enough income so that her husband and son have everything they need. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy products for her store at wholesale prices (snacks, dairy products, cookies and crackers, bulk grains, etc.). This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products so she can meet the immediate needs of her customers, increasing sales and income. She also needs to register with the chamber of commerce so that she can work in this sector. 

Her spirit of excellence and desire to get ahead push her to persevere and strive to achieve her dream of buying her own home where she will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with her family, and provide a good education for her son.

loans.use: to stock her store with groceries, bulk grains, sodas, fried snacks, liquor, and other foods.  She also needs to register with the chamber of commerce.

loans.name: Kiren

texts.en: Kiren is hardworking lady. She has been involved in a business of machine embroidery for a period of about six years. She makes beautiful embroidery patterns on pillows and bed sheets for the people of her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. It will help her to purchase more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Samayapurathal Shg - Thirupuvanam Group

texts.en:
Gangaiyammal is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her three children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. They live in a village, Thirupuvanam, in Trichy district.

Gangaiyammal is the leader of the Samayapurathal Self-Help Group, which was formed by a local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu. The NGO majorly works to improve the livelihood of the people in that region.

Gangaiyammal and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which emits much less smoke and is better than the traditional mud stove. The smokeless stove is designed for daily use and is more efficient and clean. It promotes healthier lifestyles by limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his house to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has many years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salts, grains, oil, tea, biscuits and beverages. In this way, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She expects boost in her earnings, and wishes to spend it on providing a better standard for her family members.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, grains, oil, tea, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a married woman and the mother of seven.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operation of her business, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 3 Group

texts.en:
The nine members of the Ekomefeemo 3 Group are mainly women who on average are 40 years old with four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Teshie, one of the populous neighborhoods in the city of Accra. They sell banku (cook corn and cassava dough), fish, chicken wings and thighs, foodstuff, plastic items, plates, cutlery sets, cloth, materials, enamel bowls, slippers and underwear.They are on their eighth group loan with the ID-Ghana micro-finance institution, seeking to meet their customers' needs.

Mary, who is standing first from right to left in the photo, sells banku (cook corn and cassava dough), fish, chicken wings and thighs everyday. She intends to use her loan to buy maize, fish, chicken, prepare banku (cook corn and cassava dough) and sell to customers. She sells the food throughout the day and her customers are responding very well. The people love this food because it is a traditional food, and there is high demand by customers.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan, but they have good record in paying the previous loans.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, chicken, to prepare banku (cook corn and cassava dough) and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her dishes such as meat and flour. She also needs to buy a pot, chairs and tables to provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Minibala

texts.en:
Minibala hails from the rural village of Tekatuli in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal.  She is 48 years old and is a hardworking woman who engages in livestock breeding activities besides handling her household responsibilities. She is married to Satyendranath, aged 54, who cultivates his land and grows vegetables. They are blessed with two sons. As Minibala and her husband could not provide a proper education to her sons, they work as masons.

Minibala's husband tills his small plot of land and works tirelessly on his land to grow quality vegetables. The money he earns adds to their household incomes and is saved for their future. But it is quite insufficient. Moreover, their sons also do not have consistent income. So, in order to strengthen the family economy, Minibala started rearing cattle a few years back. She purchased one cow and started her milk supply business. Her neighbors are her main customers. She understands inflation, and the growing needs of her family and children cannot be met with their current earnings. Moreover, the demand of her customers is also increasing gradually, so she has decided to purchase one more cow to improve her milk supply business.

She is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner), which helps the needy rural women by giving business loans. This loan amount will help Minibala to buy a cow. 

The additional money earned from the business will contribute toward improving their savings and providing for her children and family.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Ilanthendral Shg - Vadakarai Group

texts.en:
People Action for Transformation (PAT) manages the Ilanthendral Self Help Group, which consists of 10 members. Pushpavali is the leader of this group living in Vadakarai village, Trichy district.

Forty-two-year-old Pushpavali lives in her own house with her husband and a child. Her husband is a farmer. 

Pushpavali is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, as it is easy to use, relatively cheap and reduces the indoor pollution, whereas traditional stoves consume time and money, and the smoke emitted from these stoves can lead to respiratory diseases.

Along with Pushpavali, the other members are also requesting loans to purchase smokeless stoves to lead healthier lives.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Sakthi Shg -Manakkal Group

texts.en:
Nangai is the leader of Sakthi Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO, “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT).  

Nangai is a widow living in Manakkal, a small village in Trichy District. She is 42 years old and has a child. 

Nangai has recently learned about the Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of poisonous gas.

Nangai and the other four members are requesting a loan to buy this stove to give a healthier life to their families. They are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable stove.

loans.name: Onabibi

texts.ru:
Онабиби способная и умелая женщина из города Турсунзаде. Ей 33 года. Она работает в швейном ателье около 10 лет. У нее большой опыт и много клиентов. Однако она шьет на старой машинке, которая видна на фотографии, поэтому качество и скорость ее работы желает лучшего. Онабиби хочет расширить свое дело, она запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку. С помощью такой машинки она будет шить быстрее и качественнее. 
Онабиби с мужем воспитывают троих детей. Она хочет, чтобы они получили достойное образование и поэтому они работают усердно.
texts.en: Onabibi is a capable and intelligent woman from the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 33 years old and she has worked as a seamstress for 10 years.  She has a lot of experience and many clients.  She sews on an old machine, which you can see in the picture, which is why she wishes the quality and speed of her work were better.  Onabibi wants to increase her business, which is why she is asking for a loan so she can buy a modern computerized sewing machine.  With this machine, she can increase the speed and quality of her work.  Onabibi and her husband have three children.  She wants them to receive a good education, which is why she works so hard.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine in order to develop/grow her sewing business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable weather conditions. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tea. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two washing machines and potable water for two weeks of work

loans.name: Ifat

texts.en: Ifat has successfully built her beauty parlor business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is best known for hair styling and make up in her town. She earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenses. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy hair care products and skin products along with the packs of hair rollers, combs, and scissors. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and skin products along with the packs of hair rollers, combs, and scissors.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is single and 28 years old, living with her parents in a small village of one of the minority communities in Kosovo. She is a very hard worker, who is willing to do much to improve her living situation and life. Even though she is employed as a police officer, she also works on her land, planting corn to harvest and sell. She works with her father in this business since her salary alone is not enough to provide for the family’s needs. Now, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase new tools so she will not have to pay others to work on their land. Being able to cultivate and harvest the crops on the land themselves will save them a lot of money and allow them to increase their income and improve their standard of living. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new tools so she will not have to pay others to work on their land

loans.name: Bharathi Shg - Thirupuvanam Group

texts.en:
Gayathiri is the leader of the Bharathi Self Help Group, which is formed by the local NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. 

Gayathiri lives in Thirupuvanam village, Trichy district. 

Gayathiri is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her three children and husband. Her husband is small marginal farmer. 

Gayathiri is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than the traditional mud stove. The latter emits a lot of smoke; it is also called a kitchen killer, as it consumes more time and money. Smokeless stoves are affordable, designed for daily use, and are much better than traditional stoves.

Along with Gayathiri, five other members are requesting a loan for the same purpose and are hoping for a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
U Kaowtam is a 34-year-old lady with four children. She lives in a small village called Tankua in Koraput district of Odisha, India, with her husband and two children. A few years back, she started growing vegetables and paddy rice. She grows different types of vegetables in her field, depending upon the demand of her customers and the season. 

The group is requesting a loan of 150,000 INR. U Kaowtam will use her part to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is part of a group of 10 members, all of whom are women who live in the same community. They named their group Maa Mangala Self Help Group, and it is located in the Koraput district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Thamarai Shg - Anaikudam Group

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 40-year-old lady residing in Anaikudam, a small village of Ariyalur in Tamil Nadu, India. She has two children. Mariyam is the leader of the “Thamarai” Self-Help Group (SHG) with 14 other women. The group has been receiving loans from the local NGO, “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT), for the last ten years.

Mariyam and her group are requesting a loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. The stove is a single burner, highly efficient cookstove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel, including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cookstoves. 

Mariyam and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense, all the while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Munthiriamman Shg - Thiruvidaimarudhur Group

texts.en:
Vasanthi is married and the leader of the Munthiriamman Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People Action for Transformation in Tamil Nadu.

Vasanthi lives in her own house with family. Her husband is a small marginal farmer. They live in Thiruvidaimarudhur, a small village in Trichy district. 

Vasanthi has taken loans from the PAT previously and has repaid the loan amount on time.

Vasanthi and the other members of the group need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than a traditional stove. Smokeless stoves produce less carbon dioxide and maintain a healthy environment. It’s convenient for cooking and designed for daily use.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Чумагул 38-летняя жительница района Вахш. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей, двое дочерей и сыновей. Чумагул на протяжении восьми лет занимается шитьем. Она талантливая портниха и простоя женщина. Вышивать она научилась у своей матери и вот теперь учит своих детей. 
Чумагул берет кредит для закупа еще одной швейной машинки, чтобы ее девочки начали свое дело и научились у нее ее мастерству. Каждая женщина старается помочь своему ребенку сделать первые шаги в детстве и также первые шаги в самостоятельную жизнь. Она знает, что если у них будет свое дело, когда они станут портнихами они никогда не будут голодать, смогут вести свою жизнь.
texts.en: Jumagul is 38 years old and she lives in the Vakhsh region.  She is married with four children - two daughters and two sons - and she has been sewing professionally for eight years.  She is a talented seamstress, but she is a regular woman who learned to sew from her mother and who is now teaching her own children.  Jumagul is asking for a loan to buy another sewing machine so her daughters can start sewing on their own in her studio.  Every woman tries to help her children take their first steps to an independent life.  Jumagul knows that if her children have their own business as dressmakers, they will never go hungry and they can make their own way through life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine on which she can teach her daughters to sew.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old. She is married to Andrew and together they have been blessed with one child. She runs a retail business where she sells cosmetic products to clients within her locality. She has done this business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Agnes has requested for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy stock of salon products. These include hair oils and relaxers, and shampoos, as well as hair extensions. It is important to note that this is Agnes' third loan after successfully repaying her previous ones.

With the anticipated profits, Agnes will be able to expand her business even further. It is the hope and certainly the dream of Agnes, to live a happy life as she enjoys her business successes.

loans.use: to buy stock of salon products.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло  добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Шахло занимается бизнесом. Она начала свой бизнес 7 лет назад, потому что она нуждалась в деньгах, чтобы обеспечить своих детей. Шахло начала свой бизнес шитьем и продажей национальных одежд. Она постепенно год за годом развевает этот бизнес. Шахло с раннего утра начинает свой рабочий день. Она шьёт женские платья и продает на местном рынке. Шахло старается, шить платья на высшем уровне и таким образом привлечь покупателей. Шахло запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для покупки тканей, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahlo is a kind woman who is married with three children.  She has her own business, which she started seven years ago because she needed money to raise her children.  Shahlo is a seamstress and she sells national costumes.  Each year she increases her business, and she begins working early each day sewing women's dresses to sell at the local market.  Shahlo tries to sew her dresses to the highest quality to attract more customers.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy fabrics so she can increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabric to increase her working capital

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en: Latifan is a 34-year-old married lady and enjoys doing a work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She earns a good amount of income to contribute in the family's income. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes, and education. In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors. Currently, she is in her fifth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf foundation. This way she can manage to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She dreams of providing a prosperous future to her two children.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Stana

texts.en: Stana is a widow who lives only with her son in a minority community. She has had a difficult life raising her son by herself as her husband passed away a long time ago. They are living in very poor conditions and her situation and income has never afforded her the opportunity to improve their living conditions. Although she has been receiving social help, she tries to contribute to their needs as well, working as painter, but with a low salary. At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase new furniture and appliances, such as a bed and freezer. These items are necessary for better standards of living and comfort. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for helping her do something she could not do alone. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture and appliances, such as a bed and freezer

loans.name: Suman

texts.en:
Suman hails from Maynaguri. She is a married woman and a 20-year-old mother of two adorable children (one son and one daughter) who always bring a pleasant feeling to her. She lives with her family in a village named Mouyamari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She attended school until grade seven and had to give up education, as her parents could not afford her educational expenses, and got married at a very tender age. One of her children attends school; the other is too young.

Suman's husband, Monoranjan, is a car driver. Being a father of two children, he has lots of responsibilities, and feeding this four-member family requires a lot of hard work. Hence, he has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family, but his low income is the main challenge.  

So, in order to help her husband, Suman engaged in a milk-selling business. She rears one cow and sells milk to her neighbours. She has achieved a reputation with her customers, as she sells milk at a cheaper rate.

Suman is a visionary and enterprising woman and has always wanted to do dairy farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges she has faced is the lack of enough capital. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan, Suman is confident that her business will increase, as well as her dream of providing a better education and secure future for her children. This will be achieved with the income from her business.

Suman is relieved to know that her life can be secured through lenders such as Kiva and BJS, who help small-scale and aspiring women such as Suman. She is grateful to them.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her existing business.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Gita is an active, energetic and enterprising lady. Her family consists of five members: she, her three children (two sons and one daughter) and her husband. All her children are getting education and are in grades 11, 7 and 2. They live in a small village, Tekatuli, Maynaguri, in Jalpaiguri district in their own small kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made). Gita is illiterate and can sign her name only.

Gita's husband, Babul (aged 45 years), is a land cultivator who grows and sells vegetables in the local market. His monthly income just covers their food expenses. It is getting difficult to manage the household expenses. So, very recently Gita has started a milk supply business. She sells milk to her neighbours. Now she wants to purchase a dairy cow to improve her business by selling more milk to her clients. She is a very polite and soft-natured woman. So, her clients like her, and the demand for milk in the rural area is more; thus, her business is also increasing.

In order to purchase a cow, she borrowed a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She is hoping that buying a cow will increase her income and financial security at present and in the long run by giving them an asset that they can sell during hard times.

She dreams to give their children higher education with the profit from the business. She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow to grow her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 28-year-old vigorous lady. She has been in the tailoring business from the last 7 years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. With this loan amount she will be able to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, needles, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers, needles, and buttons.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is a married woman. She describes herself to be proactive. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of tea prices. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea

loans.name: Mahsud

texts.ru:
Махсуд позитивный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 51 года. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Махсуда домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Махсуд работает мастером в местной мастерской. В это мастерской он работает уже долгое время и получает хороший доход. Этого дохода хватает Махсуду и его семье только на проживание. 

Но у него есть мечта, Махсуд хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Махсуд обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Махсуд надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahsud is a positive and responsible man.  He is 51 years old and he is married with four children.  He lives with his family in a small village, but the home in which he lives is in poor condition and was not built well enough for his family.  Mahsud's wife is a homemaker, and she is a very hard-working and caring mother.  Mahsud himself is employed in a local workshop, in which he has worked for a long time and he makes a decent living.  His income is just enough for his family to get by on.

But Mahsud has a dream; he wants to build a big home for his family.  But he doesn't have enough money to make this dream a reality.  His income is not enough to build this new home, which is why he turned to Arvand for a loan to buy the building materials to construct this home.  Mahsud is hoping for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Nebahate

texts.en: Nebahate is a 38 year old Roma woman with 4 children. She is currently employed as a cleaning woman in a hotel while her husband transports goods for others for a living. They are very poor and live in substandard living conditions, which is not healthy for their children. Their toilet is in dire need of repair and they need a boiler to create access to hot water for showering and cleaning. For the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to make these repairs and improvements. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her toilet and buy a boiler for hot water

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 52-year-old widow woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of three sons, and she has a store for selling women's clothes in the city. She imports hair products from outside Palestine. Samia would like to improve her business and prepare her store for the new season.

Samia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell in her store. 

By taking this loan, Samia will be able to improve her store and increase the sales. 

Samia appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing

loans.name: Chepkoskei

texts.en: Chepkoskei is a married woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, sugar, bread, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks, bread, flour, and other items. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Elizabeta

texts.en:
Elizabeta lives in a Roma community, has five children, makes handicrafts, and is married to a driver. She is a hardworking woman who balances taking care of her home, her children, and making her crafts. She has developed a large client base, and customers. Her business is very well known in the area, and many people are interested in her work, helping her to make a good profit and a decent salary. During the current summer months she has her most work, making orders for weddings and other celebrations. 

Now, she is requesting a loan for materials for her work so that she can satisfy the customer orders and demands and increase her profit. The loan will help her to provide a better future for her children, contribute to saving for a workshop, and eventually hiring an employee.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her work

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 49-year-old woman from the rural village, Sahapara, in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband Arun, aged 58 years, is also illiterate. They live with their two sons. Their sons are also deprived of education due to their poor economic resources. Now one of them works in a tailoring shop and the other in a grocery shop.

She is a hardworking mother who struggles hard and tries to give her children everything they need. Saraswati and her husband both are engaged in a business of making bori (a conical ball made of pulses) used in vegetable curry in India. They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbors, relatives and friends, and earn for their family. They work hard to generate income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family.

Saraswati is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase ingredients for making more boris, in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business, which will generate more income. She dreams to earn more profit from her business and hopes to have a comfortable life and further expand her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for their existing business of making "bori" (a conical ball made of pulses).

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat has expertise in embroidery and has used her skill to provide for her family for many years now. During initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Now she has requested another loan worth Rs 40,000 to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of pearls and stones. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Musarat has taken up. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of pearls and stones.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees has successfully built her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has become popular in her town and has attained good number of customers. In this way she makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a variety of cloth by considering the demands of her customers. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloth.

loans.name: Rezq

texts.en:
Rezq is a 20-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarm city. He works with his family in raising sheep. They have a barn next to the family house. It is a good business, and gives the family a very good income. 

Rezq requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. By taking this loan, Rezq and his family will be able to increase their productivity and also their income. 

Rezq appears in the photo in the sheep barn.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare parts for his auto repair workshop

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a married mother of two children, and operates her own handicraft business. While her husband works as a police officer with a low salary, she works from home, adding to their income and helping to meet their needs. She has always enjoyed her work, and hopes that she will be able to one day open her own workshop. 

For now, she needs a loan to replace her machine that she has destroyed by using it so much through the years. She would like to be able to purchase a new one, and also some material for her work, so that she can increase her profit and work more effectively and efficiently. 

She promises to pay on time, and is very thankful for the opportunity.

loans.use: To replace her machine

loans.name: Majdoleen

texts.en:
Majdoleen is a 46-year-old married lady from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. She is the mother of ten kids; three sons and seven daughters. They live in a small house. Majdoleen and her husband work as farmers on their land, where they plant seasonal crops and olive trees.

Majdoleen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more olive seedlings for their farm. By taking this loan, the farm productivity will increase and so will their income.

Majdoleen appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for their farm.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stocks of cereals.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being determined. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for five years and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the 50,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings) loan to buy more stocks of drinks. She hopes that in the future, she will have a depot. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of drinks.

loans.name: Azemine

texts.en: Azemine is 39 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is a construction worker with a low salary and they receive social help. She is very happy to have the opportunity to have a new home that the municipality has built for them. In the past they were very poor and had terrible living conditions and standards, so the new home is much appreciated and needed. The new house is not completely finished and still needs the toilet to be completed, so she is requesting a loan. This loan will help to contribute to her family’s better living standards and situation and she is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her toilet and improve the living conditions.

loans.name: Esrellita

texts.en:
Esrellita is 48 years old and has five children. Esrellita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Esrellita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esrellita has been in the pig fattening business for 9 years now, and has previously borrowed 23 times from NWTF in order to sustain her business. 

In the future, Esrellita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Xhevrije

texts.en: Xhevrije is a Roma woman, married, and the  mother of five children between 9 months and 11 years old. She is a housewife and her husband earns a living by cutting wood to sell for heating. As with all members of the Ashkali community, they are living in very poor conditions. Because their income is very low and inconsistent, they have never had the chance to improve their home. It’s for this reason that she is requesting a loan in order to complete repairs necessary for living. She hopes that this loan will improve her family life and is very grateful for the opportunity. She hopes in the future to find employment after her youngest child is a little older. They promise to pay on time.

loans.use: A loan of $1,350 helps Xhevrijeto complete repairs to her house which is necessary for living.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 53 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is married to Abdalla and together they have been blessed with seven children, all above 18 years old.

Constance is in the education sector. She has dedicated her life to improving lives of children in her community by teaching them the knowledge and skills she has acquired. This has been her source of joy as well as an income generating activity which earns her 10,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings) per month. She has done this for the last seven years.

Constance has requested her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya of 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase stationery for the school as well as to improve the physical building of the school. This will ensure the environment is conducive for the children to learn.

With the anticipated profits, Constance will be able to improve her family's living standards. Her hope and dream is to live a happy life together with her family.

loans.use: to improve the school's building.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 26-year-old married lady and the mother of nine sons and daughters. She lives in Southern Ghour, Jordan. Hayat has been helping her husband in covering their household fees for one year by running her own business selling accessories and cosmetics at her house to her neighbors and friends. Her business has been profitable for her. For that, she decided to expand it by opening her own independent store so that she will build a strong customer base. But she doesn't have enough money to so. For that, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to open her own accessories and cosmetics store.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where he sells motorcycle spare parts together with produce for income generation. His businesses are challenged by price fluctuations but through hard work, he has managed to look after his family's increasing demands. Frank is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Durley Yazmin

texts.es:
Ella es Durley, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas como empanadas, pasteles de pollo, buñuelos, entre otros, desde hace aproximadamente 4 años en un pequeño carrito de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Trabaja en compañía de su madre quien siempre procura por ayudarle mucho con su negocio.

Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en muchos restaurantes en meses pasados y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar un enfriador para vender bebidas gaseosas y un vitrina calentadora para exhibir y al mismo tiempo mantener sus alimentos calientes para el público.

Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía por eso merece una gran ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Durley is a woman of good character and strong will, with a great desire to get ahead and make progress for her husband and their two children. She decided to start her business about 4 years ago, preparing and selling foods like empanadas, fried chicken pies, buñuelos [fried dough balls], and other things. She began with a small cart and a lot of desire and drive. She works with her mother who has always helped her a lot. She learned the trade by working in many restaurants in the past, and this let her gain a wealth of experience.

Today she wants to give a little push to her business, which is why she asks for a loan to buy a cooler to sell sodas and a warming case to display hot foods and keep them warm for her customers. She has overcome challenges and faced them with courage, which is why she deserves help with her business.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and a warming case to keep foods fresh and in good condition.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
El señor Catalino desde muy joven comenzó con labores de trabajo pues la comida en su casa era escasa y su familia no podía ofrecerle una educación por lo que salió a trabajar en la plaza de mercado como mensaje informal y cargando bultos a carros. 

Junto un pequeño capital e inicio con la compra y venta de plátano actividad que ejerce hasta la actualidad. 

Catalino es un hombre de 41 años de edad vive con su pareja con la cual tiene 6 hijos de 22, 20, 18, 21, 12, 7 años que depende de él, algunos de ellos le ayudan con el montaje de carga (ver en foto dos de sus seis hijos). 
 
Al tener una familia número su capital es muy bajo para invertir y en otros casos no tiene capital suficiente para realizar su carga por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de plátano para seguir con su profesión. 

Catalino es un gran soñador que quiere tener un deposito grande donde pueda ayudar a su familia con empleos dignos para mantener a su familia, mudarse de barrio y tener una casa más digna en mejores condiciones y dejarles un excelente negocio a sus hijos
texts.en:
Catalino started working at a very young age because the food in his home was scarce and his family could not provide him with an education. For those reasons he started working in the marketplace as an informal postman loading messages into cars. He saved up some money and started buying and selling plantains, which is what he is still doing.

Catalino is 41 years old and lives with his wife with whom he has 6 children ages 22, 20, 18, 21, 12, and 7 that depend on him. Some of them help him with the large loads. Two of his children are present with him in the photo. By having a numerous family, his capital is very low to invest and in some cases he does not have the capital to perform his job. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy plantains to continue with his profession.

Catalino is a big dreamer and wants to have a large store where he can help his family with a worthy employment to support them. He wants to move from his neighborhood and have a better home in better conditions, and leave an excellent business for his children.

loans.use: to buy plantains to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his business, like groceries, staple grains, soda pops, snacks, liquors, and other kinds of food.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a single man. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the KES20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes that he will have a quality life in the future. He will use the expected profits to pay his bills and expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.en:
Fidelina is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fidelina is 62 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Fidelina has a direct selling BoardWalk products business in the Philippines. Fidelina has requested a loan of PHP32,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from BoardWalk to sell to her customers.

Fidelina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Fidelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from BoardWalk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra hace aproximadamente 1 año y media comenzó como operaria de confección en la empresa de su cuñada ya que necesitaba ingresos para mantener su hogar, para su hijo de 9 años de edad que depende de ella, pues necesita estudio, alimentación. 

Un operario es un empleo muy arduo en el cual se trabajaba aproximadamente 12 horas diarias para sacar producción.

La señora Sandra desea iniciar su vida como independiente por lo que necesita un crédito para la compra de maquina fileteadora, hilos, tela para iniciar su propio taller de confección y estar más cerca de su hijo y con una mejor proyección pues obtendría mejores ingresos si triunfa. Inicialmente trabajara con su suegra y la idea es comenzar a conseguir clientes y adentrarse en el mercado.

Sueña con capacitarse más en el tema de la confección para dar un mejor servicio y hacer de su local una firme y productiva empresa.
texts.en: About a year ago, Sandra began working as a machinist in her sister-in-law's sewing workshop because she needed money for her household. Her 9 year old son is depending on her and needs food and an education. Being a machinist is a very hard job that requires working 12 hours every day to meet production. Sandra wants to become independent, which is why she needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, threads, and fabric to start her own sewing workshop. She will be closer to her son and have greater influence, and she will make more profits if she succeeds. At the beginning she will work with her mother-in-law and the idea is to start to find clients and introduce herself into the market. She dreams of getting more training as a seamstress so that she can provide better service and make turn it into a steady and productive business.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric, needles and thread to start her sewing business.

loans.name: Alpana

texts.en:
Alpana is a young and energetic woman of 28 years from Maynaguri.  She is married, and has two children (one son and one daughter). She has an elementary education. Her children go to school. One of her children is a student of grade 2 and the other is too young for school.  They live in a remote village, Tekatuli, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Alpana's husband Sanjay is a musician by profession and has a party band. He and his group perform musical shows in every kind of community party. They play different kinds of musical instruments and sing songs at different social occasions.  In this community, most of the people play musical instruments at weddings, birthdays, and other occasions. He has been in this business for many years. Alpana is also engaged with the same business. The summer is a popular time for people to get married, which generates much business for him and he is well paid to run his family well. He also rents musical instruments when there is any special ceremony in the village.

Now he would like to purchase a few musical instruments as some of them are not working properly; he's looking to buy more castanets and drums.

So Alpana is asking for the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase some musical instruments. She hopes this loan will help them to grow his business and generate more income to run her family smoothly. She has a dream to admit her children to a renowned school, which she hopes would be possible through this loan.

She thanks her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments for her husband's party band business.

loans.name: Phulabala

texts.en:
52-year-old Phulabala is a woman of courage and strength.  She is from a remote village, Nirendrapur. She is married and is blessed with only one son, who is engaged in a small business. She is illiterate and so her husband Kamal.

Her husband works on her farmland all day long and grows vegetables.  He sells his produces to the local market and earns for his family. Phulabala runs her own cattle-rearing business for an additional income for her family. She sells cow milk in her neighborhood and nearby villages. She believes that there is no lack of opportunities for those who are willing to work hard. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and save for a secure future. 

Phulabala seeks a loan from BJS to buy a new dairy cow to grow her business. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Phulabala hopes to provide a financial sustenance to her family.

She is very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and increase her milk sales and profit.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en: Silas is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the KES20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes that he will have a transport company in the future. He will use the expectd profits to pay his bills and expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy educational toys for the children she takes care of.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a very young woman of only 28 years.  She is married and a mother of two school-going children who are in grade 7 and grade 3.  She and her husband Rajani both are illiterate who can sign their names only. They live in a remote village, Khagrabari, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Saraswati's husband is engaged in a business of manufacturing traditional drums such as Tabla (a pair of hand drums played with hands), dhol (a two-headed drums) and sells them locally. In this locality most of the people play musical instruments on religious occasions. Saraswati is a housewife who manages household works as well as helps her husband in his business. Her husband is the only earning member for the family.  But due to lack of capital, he can't grow his business. 

So Saraswati has taken a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to purchase necessary materials for her husband's business. She is hoping that the income from the business will provide a better life to her family. In the future, she will use the income for their secure life and provide better education to her children.

She is grateful for this opportunity and appreciates her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband's existing musical instrument-making business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her business. Gertrudes has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, meat, etc. for her business

loans.name: Telma Del Carmen

texts.es: Telma de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 5 años presta sus servicio domésticos. Telma desea construir un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda ya que actualmente cuenta con uno que es abonero, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: taza lavable, cemento, arena tuberías y grava, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un servicio sanitario lavable en su vivienda.
texts.en: Telma, 43, owns the home where she lives with her family. She is a tenacious women who has worked for 5 years as a domestic employee. She wants to build a bathroom with a flush toilet, because all they have right now is a composting latrine. She asks FUSAI for a loan to buy: a washbasin, cement, sand, tubes, and gravel, as well as to pay for labor needed to build a bathroom in her home.

loans.use: to buy a washbasin, cement, sand, tubes, gravel and to pay laborers to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 36 years old. He is married to Loyce and together they have been blessed with six children. Benjamin refused to give up on life and therefore he decided to open a small retail shop with the money he had then, and started selling products like washing soap, small-pack tea leaves, milk, and other household goods. This has been his income generating activity/business for the last 11 years and he currently earns a monthly income of KES 48,000.

Benjamin has requested his third loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 which he will use to purchase stock of retail products like washing soap, bathing soap, tea leaves, and assorted snacks to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Benjamin will be able to expand his business further. His dream and hope is to live a happy life as he enjoys his business success.

loans.use: to add products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air compressor and cleaning products to provide a better service and increase his sales.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita lives in a remote village of Maynaguri, in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  She is 42 years old and illiterate, only able to sign her name. Both her children are students of different grades in secondary level.  They have a mud and bamboo-made house which lacks all the basic facilities.

Her husband Narayan, aged 47 years, works as a daily laborer under a building contractor. However, the seasonal nature of this work and its unreliability leaves his family financially vulnerable. As a result, Sabita has been rearing a cow for many years, and the milk she gets from it, when sold, keeps her family clothed and fed.

So, to make her earning from this business sustainable, she seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy another cow.  She is expecting an increase in her monthly income after she develops her number of cows. She lives a dignified life with her family, and developing this business will allow her to retain her financial independence to provide better food, health and education to her children.

She conveys her gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is a 58-year-old widow who hails from Maynaguri. She is an illiterate woman, who can sign her name only.  She lives in Bankandi, a small village in Jalpaiguri district with her two sons. One of them works in a mobile repairing shop and the other is a car driver.

Her husband used to sell bori (conical balls made of different pulses) in the local market. After his death, she is now looking after the business. She makes these bori at home by sun-drying them, then with the help of her sons sells them in the market. She needs many necessary ingredients like urad dal, red chili powder, ginger powder, water, etc., for making good quality bori. 

For this reason she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy these varieties of necessary ingredients to make a huge quantity of bori, made of different types of pulses. There is a great demand for her bori in the local area.

Shanti has insufficient capital to buy the raw materials for supplying a huge quantity of bori in her locality. She expects that, with this loan, she can fulfill the market demand for bori. In the future she wants to increase her business and see it flourish.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making bori

loans.name: Carmen Lucia

texts.es:
Carmen una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora de 45 años de edad, nacida y criada bajo el seno de una humilde familia, donde la honestidad y el trabajo son sus principales valores. 
Es madre de 3 hijos de 21, 16 y 19 años hombres que viven con ella y depende de ella y de su padre. Se dedica a la venta de mercancía como cuadernos e insumos de papelería y algunos dulces, pero no tiene un local propia es más bien algo informal que inicio como medida para generar recursos para ayudar en su hogar que como se visualiza es muy humilde.  
Solicita un crédito para la compra de dulces, snack, cuadernos, lapiceros, pegantes, cosmeticos etc. 

Con la ayuda del crédito tendrá excelente variedad y ofrecerá un buen servicio a la comunidad la cual no tiene muchos de estos locales. 
Su sueño es poder montar una papelería formal y crecer paso a paso hacia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very enterprising and determined woman. She is 45 years old and she was born and raised in a humble family, for whom honesty and hard work were the main values.

She is the mother of three sons, aged 21, 16 and 19. They live with her and are dependent on her and their father. She makes a living by selling merchandise, such as books and stationery supplies and some sweets, but she does not have her own business premises. It is more something informal she began as a way to generate income for her household, which is very poor.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy sweets, snacks, books, pens, glue, cosmetics, and other things. With the help of the loan she will have an excellent variety of products and she will offer a good service to the community, which does not have many of these stores.

Her dream is to be able to set up a formal stationery store and grow little by little towards a better future.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, books, pens, glue, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel, mayor de edad casada con cuatro hijos los cuales solo uno esta aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, Maria por falta de recursos económico y por la pobreza en la que vivía no estudiar aprendiendo solo a leer y escribir, ya que se vio obligada a trabajar a temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, donde hoy en día es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en una mini-pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo diario en pequeñas cantidades como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabón, aceite, cepillo de dientes, bolsitas de avenas, pinolillos, salsa de tomates, sopas maruchan, sopas maggis, papel higiénicos, toallas sanitarias entre otros mas,sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados, distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio hace mas de 12 años con fondos propios y con el objetivo de ayudar con los gastos en su hogar el cual hoy en día es una fuente de ingreso mas para su hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder realizar ciertas mejoras a sus vivienda y el de incrementar su inventario en el negocio. Maria  dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azucar, frijoles, aceite, productos congelados, cafe, shampoo, detergentes entre otros mas.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is adult who is married, with four children, of whom only one is still her responsibility. She is originally from one of the communities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with a great desire for personal achievement. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Because of the lack of economic resources and because of the poverty in which she lived, she did not go to school, learning only to read and write, since she was obliged to work at an early age to help with the household expenses. 

Today she is a micro-entrepreneur, proprietor and manager of her own business, which consists of a mini grocery store located in her home, where she offers products for daily use in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, soap, oil, toothbrushes, little bags of oats, pinolillo (a cacao and cornmeal drink), tomato sauce, Maruchan soups, Maggi soups, toilet paper,  and sanitary napkins, among other items. She makes her purchases for cash from the markets, distributors, and truck distributors in this area. Her sales are for cash. She has regular and occasional customers. She began her business more than 12 years ago with her own funds and with the goal of helping with the expenses of her household. Today it is one more source of income for her household. 

One of her dreams is to be able to make certain improvements in her house, as well as increasing the inventory in her business. Maria works in her business some 10 hours a day, offering her products, so that in the not too distant future she can obtain more income. The purpose of this financing is to invest in working capital by buying products for household use such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, frozen products, coffee, shampoo, and detergents, among other items.

loans.use: to buy household products such as detergents, soap, sanitary napkins, rice, beans, oil, sugar, and frozen products, among other items

loans.name: Emine

texts.en: Borrower Emine is 38 years old and a mother of three children between the ages of 10 and 15 years, all living in a small village in the southern part of Kosovo. In order to earn a living, her husband (in the picture with her) works transporting goods for others, which comes with a low salary and sometimes inconsistent work. Because of these factors, they have never been able to save enough money in order to repair and renovate their house, which is very old and in urgent need of repairs. When Emine heard about this opportunity for a loan, she decided to request some help for the first time so that she can improve the living conditions of her family. She hopes that this loan will help to repair and renovate their house, which is very old and in urgent need of repairs. Her goal is to be able to find a job and contribute to the family income and budget. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she would like to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair and renovate her house.

loans.name: Vllaznim

texts.en:
The borrower, Vllaznim, comes from an Ashkali community, which is very poor and has a very high unemployment rate. He is young, only 23 years old and recently married. He lives with his wife and father. The house that he lives in is very old and has never had any repairs or improvements done to it, resulting in it being in very poor condition and difficult to live in. In order to earn a living he works hard cutting wood to sell for heating, but the income he generates is very low because he doesn't have a machine to help him work faster and more efficiently.

At this time, only loans can help him to improve the standard of living since his salary is not enough. When he heard about the opportunity given to others in need by the lenders he decided to borrow a loan in order to renovate their toilet which is in terrible condition and unsanitary. He is trying to work hard now to improve their living conditions so that he can start his own family and be able to raise his children in a clean, healthy environment.

loans.use: to renovate his toilet.

loans.name: Benkasigui  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 8 membres du groupe BENKASIGUI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOURA-PEULH, un des villages de la commune de TORAKOLOBA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec BINTOU , 1ère femme assise à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir :0,5  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  TORAKOLOBA , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 11 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Benkasigui 3 group are married women who on average are 40 years old with four children, all living in traditional families in Toura-Peulh, a village in the municipality of Torakoloba, which is part of the San Circle in the fourth administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Bintou, the first woman kneeling on the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment, and pay for plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Torakoloba, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 11,000 CFA francs by the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, small farming equipment, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Tito

texts.en: Tito is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Benkasigui  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe BENKASIGUI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOURA-PEULH, un des villages de la commune de TORAKOLOBA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide avec ASSITAN , femme au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir :0,5  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  TORAKOLOBA , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
