Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 8 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkasigui 4 group are married women who on average are 33 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Toura-Peulh, a village in the municipality of Torakoloba, which is part of the San Circle in the fourth administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Assitan, the woman in the middle of the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment, and pay for plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Torakoloba, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 8,000 CFA francs by the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, small farming equipment, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Meet Beatrice. She is a small-scale farmer from Nyamira, a rural town known for banana growing and sugarcane farming. Beatrice has a husband, and they are blessed with five children whom she has fought so hard to raise. 

For the past 10 years, Beatrice has been actively involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been milk and tea farming. She sells her produce to the nearby market and also to neighbors, and has been making positive strides. Beatrice is seeking a loan to start poultry farming and be able to make her dream come true. She is very passionate about poultry farming, and the most enjoyable task is raising the poultry.

Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people. Beatrice does not have to worry about competition because the market is there and this will assure her of high profits and improved living conditions. Through the loan, she will be able to benefit from manure from the birds and also apart from selling eggs and meat, she will sell feathers, hence, boosting her income level. Additional profits from poultry will permanently change her life, and she will be able to take care of the family expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, soap, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Uyetie 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 3 membres du groupe UYETIE 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOURA MANKAN, un des villages de la commune de TOURAKOLOBA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide et le mil avec   FATOUMA, femme au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à   TOURAKOLOBA  , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 49 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The three members of the Uyetie 3 group are married women who on average are 28 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Toura Mankan, one of the villages in the municipality of Tourakoloba, which is part of the San Circle in the fourth administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crops are groundnuts and millet featuring Fatouma, the woman in the middle of the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment, and pay for plowing to cultivate two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Tourakoloba, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 49,000 CFA francs by the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, small farming equipment, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a Mexican artisan in Oaxaca who weaves traditional Zapotec rugs from wool tinted with organic dyes. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, repair the netting on his looms, and make improvements to his workshop. Gregorio has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "My grandmother would take me to buy wool. She'd wash it, card it, spin it and dye the yarn. This job is traditionally done by women. By the age of 12, I could reach the pedals of the handloom. Ever since, I've woven rugs, and now my sons have also learned our craft. My favorite patterns are of mountains and rows of diamonds because they remind me a lot of my father. I feel proud that my sons also weave. We are able to support our families without having to leave home. "I would like to congratulate all of you on this wonderful initiative, and thank you for the support you offer to me and my family." Use the link below to view Gregorio's Zapotec wool rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4534

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, repair the netting on his looms, and make improvements to his workshop

loans.name: Manuel Pedro

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de un albañil.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. El es casado y  tiene 4 hijos por los cuales tiene que realizar un gran esfuerzo bajo un sol agotador para dar a sus hijos la condición de vida que ellos se merecen.

La actividad que Manuel realiza a diario es la construcción de casas de las personas que las necesitan, el es un buen albañil en su comunidad donde vive el se caracteriza por el trabajo que realiza y las realiza bien hechos y seguros. El empezó como un ayudante pero no ganaba nada y el se decidió a albañil desde entonces el lleva trabajando 18 años de realizar dicha actividad.

El uso que le dará el crédito es para la compra de terreno que desde hace un tiempo atrás lo a querido realizar y ahora le ofrecieron una oportunidad  para comprarla, las aspiraciones de don Manuel es ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de su comunidad y construir casas para sus hijos para tener una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Life gave Manuel an opportunity to work as an employee of a mason. It was what he had been hoping for - not just an open door, but what was behind that door. And what he found was something that defined what he wanted to be.

He is married and has four children, for whom he has to make a great effort under a grueling sun to give his children the standard of living they deserve.

The activity Manuel does daily is the construction of houses for people who need them. He is a good mason. In his community where he lives, he is known for the work he does, and he does it well and safely. He began as an assistant but didn't earn anything and decided to be a mason. Since then, he has been working 18 years to do this activity.

The use he will give the loan is to buy land that he had wanted to achieve from a while ago, and he is now being given an opportunity to buy it. Manuel's aspiration is to see his children become professionals in different career fields in their community and to build houses for his children so they have a proper standard of living.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of flour, soap and sugar. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, soap and sugar

loans.name: Conceptor

texts.en:
Conceptor is a mixed farmer living in the rich Kisii highlands of Kenya, an area that has favorable weather patterns and the cash crop is banana.  “Matoke” is the favorite meal and it’s a delicacy prepared from bananas. She is married and has six children of school-going age and has fought so hard raise them. She has been farming for the past 15 years and her source of income has been milk, tea and crops. Dairy farming is close to her heart and she really enjoys milking her cows. The fact that she loves dairy farming can be seen right from the names she has given the cows. One of his cows is named “matonto”, which is a Gusii word denoting beauty.

A lack of capital has always been a challenge to Conceptor and this has been a setback to her in trying to increase her dairy business. She is seeking kindly funds to buy a quality dairy cow that is of a quality breed. The dairy cow that she plans to buy will be producing between 10-15 liters in a single day. This amount will greatly boast her sales volume.

Since dairy farming is a profitable business venture, she will reap more profits because the demand for milk is very high and this will boast her income level. Through the training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has been taught how to be disciplined with finances and she plans to use the extra income she will be making to fully repay the loan and secure the future of her school-going children. She plans to open a very large milk-selling business and channel the profits to other projects she currently has pending.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. His primary customers are regular. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy sugar, flour and other items. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Kapan town of Syunik region. She lives there with her only son, who is a constructor. 

She works at a local company as an operator. The salaries that Lusine and her son earn are hardly enough for covering daily living costs. In order to become financially more stable, Lusine is also engaged in cosmetics sales. She receives orders from locals in the town and does her best to cover their needs.

Lusine has applied for this loan to be able to purchase cosmetics for selling to her customers and covering current orders. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics for selling to customers and covering the current orders

loans.name: Wolale A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  WOLALE A  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à CINZARA, un des villages de la commune de SAN cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 6ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le mil, le riz et l’arachide avec WARABA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers  la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN , après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 41 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Wolale A group are married women who on average are 40 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Cinzara, a village in the municipality of San, part of the San Circle in the fourth administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their sixth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crops are millet, rice and groundnuts featuring Waraba, the first woman standing from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment, and pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare (about 2.4 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in San, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 41,500 CFA francs by the end of the growing season.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, small farming equipment, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en: Germaine is aged 32 years. She has been selling boutique for one year. With the loan she would like to buy more Fanta, sugar, rice and beans. The profit from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more Fanta, sugar, rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a baker. She bakes different types of bread and cakes and sells to local food markets. Lusine lives in Stepanavan town with her husband and and two children: an 18-year-old daughter and 17-year-old son.
 
For the bakery business that she operates, Lusine needs some funds to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for baking bread and cakes. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for baking bread and cakes

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 36-year-old man married to Elizabeth who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with two children. Felix has been operating a second-hand clothes shop for five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Felix is now servicing his third loan of KES 72,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy new trousers and shirts to sell to his customers.  The profits he earns will be used to expand his wife’s green grocery business and educate his children.  He hopes to be a successful businessman and grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy new trousers and shirts to sell

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica de 53 años de edad, desde hace 3 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares y amigos, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y pagar la educación de sus hijos.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues podría aumentar su oferta de productos.

Invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como jeans, camisas, camisetas, brindando mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Gloria tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.

Este crédito afectara su familia de una manera muy positiva pues así sus hijos tendrán una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Gloria is an enterprising and dynamic 53-year-old woman. Three years ago she started selling merchandise to relatives and friends, in order to earn an income to support her household economy and pay for her children's education.

This loan will help Gloria to strengthen her business as she will be able to increase the number of products on offer.

Gloria will use this loan to buy clothes - such as jeans blouses, and shirts - in bulk, providing better service to her customers and making her business more profitable.

Gloria's goal is to move forward with her business. She wants to be a successful trader and offer her family and better quality of life and greater well-being.

This loan will have a positive effect on Gloria's family as her children will receive a better education.

loans.use: to buy clothes - such as jeans and shirts - in bulk to increase sales and to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy recently born cattle to offer new services at his farm.

loans.name: Icakunze Group

texts.fr:
Espérance   fait partie du groupe  Icakunze et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 40 ans et est marié à Damien un  tailleur .Ensemble ils ont 1  enfant de 10 ans,  qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, huile de  palme,...) depuis 4 ans. 

C’est  son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  riz, de haricot, d'huile de palme,  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle  et  voir son  enfant  étudier.
texts.en:
Espérance is part of the Icakunze group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and is married to Damien, a tailor. They have one 10-year-old child who attends school. 

She has been managing a retail shop (rice, beans, palm oil, ...) for the past four years. 

This is her first credit loan with Turame. The Kiva loan will enable her to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, and palm oil, for resale to earn more. 

In coming years she would like to buy a plot of land and ensure her child's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, and palm oil, for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: Avelina de 56 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca en su vivienda, además sus hijos aportan a la economía familiar y su esposo es agricultor y cosecha frijol y maíz para el consumo. Avelina desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda que actualmente son de adobe lo que provoca focos de anidación de plagas. Además desea encementar el piso de la misma. Por lo que Avelina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Avelina is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and four adult children. Avelina is a tenacious woman for, who five years, has been selling cow milk from her home. Her children also support the family economy. Avelina's husband is a farmer. He grows corn and beans for consumption. Avelina wants to plaster the walls of her home. The walls are currently adobe and this causes illness. In addition Avelina wants to cement the floor of her home. To carry out this work, Avelina is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of her home, and cement the floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of her home, and cement the floor.

loans.name: Yan Carlos

texts.es:
YAN CARLOS, tiene 23 años de edad, él es estudiante universitario de la carrera de Contabilidad. Eligió ésta carrera porque le agrada el movimiento económico, lleva estudiando la mitad de la carrera es decir aproximadamente dos años y seis meses, ha superado muchos obstáculos pero sobre todo su mayor dificultad es adquirir los materiales educativos y de trabajo que solicitan en la universidad. Paralelamente a sus estudios el trabaja como maestro de producción por horas para así poder ayudarse en los  gastos de su universidad.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales educativos y de trabajo contables.
texts.en:
Yan Carlos is 23 years old and a studying accounting at university. He chose this degree because he like economics. Yan Carlos is halfway through his course (he has completed two and a half years). He has overcome many obstacles but his greatest difficulty has been buying educational material that he needs. In addition to his studies, Yan Carlos works has a part-time job to help cover university costs.

This loan will be used to buy educational materials for his accounting degree.

loans.use: to buy invest in educational material for his degree in accounting.

loans.name: Chhoem's Group

texts.en: Chhoem is a villager who lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 45 years old and has one child who is in school. She has been a farmer for 20 years. She earns about 45,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Chhoem from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that this loan will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a single man. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a mechanic business where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motor vehicle repair business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a widowed woman with five children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of rice. Her business goal is to own a rice mill within five years. In the future, she hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a single woman with six children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of rice. Her goal is to own a big wholesale business within five years. In the future, she hopes to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a widowed woman with three children. She describes herself as determined and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells blankets and duvets. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stock of blankets and duvets. In the future, she hopes to educate her children. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of blankets and duvets

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a married man with five children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells spare parts and paint. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital. He will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of spare parts and paint. His business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare parts and paint

loans.name: Smela

texts.en:
Smela is from Kapan town of the Syunik region. She is involved in a retail business. Specifically, she trades clothing in nearby villages. 

Smela lives with her husband and two children: a son and daughter. 

Smela's business helps her to cover her family's basic costs. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase new stock of clothing for reselling to customers.

The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for reselling to customers.

loans.name: Haydee Mayensi

texts.es: Haydee de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y los 3 hijos que han procreado: una niña de 7 meses y dos varones de 7 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo tales como: cremas, lociones, desodorantes maquillaje, delineadores, etc. actividad que le permite aportar a la economía familiar, su esposo es profesor en un centro escolar. Haydee desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: bloque de cemento, arena, grava y cemento para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Haydee is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children: a 7-month-old daughter  and two sons who are 7 and 3 years old. She is an enterprising woman who has been selling beauty products via catalogue for seven years: creams, lotions, deodorants, make-up, eyeliner etc. This enables her to contribute to the family economy. Her husband is a school teacher. Haydee wants to build a room in her house, and is therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to buy: cement blocks, sand, gravel and cement to build a room in her house.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sand, gravel and cement to build a room in her house

loans.name: Mercedes De Maria

texts.es: Mercedes de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida como cosmetóloga realizando diversos trabajos como: manicure, pedicure, tintes, mechas, rayos, cortes de cabello, etc. además es promotora de una empresa. Mercedes desea construir un corredor y una cocina en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, cemento, ladrillo, grava, hierro y pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un corredor y una cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 28, lives with her mother in a house of their own. She is an entrepreneurial woman who started working as a cosmetologist three years ago. She offers different services, like pedicure, haircuts and different coloring techniques. She also sells products on a catalogue.

Mercedes wants to build a corridor and a kitchen, which is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI. She will buy sand, cement, bricks, gravel and iron bars, and will pay for the labor needed to build them.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, bricks and iron bars, and pay for the labor needed to build a corridor and a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to sell, such as hand creams, gels, hair products, dyes and nail polish.

loans.name: Felipa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Felipa de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida como promotora de salud ayudando de esta manera a su comunidad y aportando a su vez a la economía del hogar, su compañero de vida apoya económicamente gracias a su trabajo de agricultor. Felipa desea construir un cuarto para la cocina. Por lo anterior solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, hierro, arena y grava, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipa, 51, lives with her life partner and her 14-year-old daughter in a house of their own. She is a tenacious woman who works as a health promoter. With this job, she helps the community and can contribute to the family’s economy. Her partner also contributes; he works in agriculture.

Felipa wants to build a kitchen and this is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI. She will buy bricks, cement, iron bars, sand and gravel. She will also pay for the labor needed to build it.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron bars, sand and gravel, and to pay for the labor needed to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
El campo, las zonas verdes, los campesinos personas pujantes, responsables, y unos verdaderos magos pero en el sentido de que tienen numerosas familias y pueden mantenerlos a todos ellos con escasos recursos o con un negocio que en verdad cualquiera se pregunta cómo hacen para alimentar una familia tan grande. 
Una de estas campesinas es Miriam una mujer soltera de 43 años de edad madre de 4 hijos que puede sostener a su familia gracias a una venta de cerdos que tiene en su hogar, solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos y seguir sosteniendo su negocio y apoyar incondicionalmente a sus amados hijos. 
Sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio, con su familia, con su proyecto en el cual solo trabaja y trabaja para mejorar las condiciones de su familia por tal razón necesita el crédito urgente pues es la oportunidad para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
The field, the green spaces, and the farmers who are vigorous, responsible, and real magicians in the sense that they have large families and are able to provide for them with little resources and a business that would make anyone question how they are able to provide for such a large family.

One of these farmers is Miriam--a single, 43 year old woman with four children who is able to sustain her family thanks to the sale of pigs that she raises at home. She is asking for this loan to buy pigs so she can continue her work and unconditionally support her loving children.

She dreams of carrying on with her business, with her family, and with her mission to work just to better the conditions of her family. That is why she urgently needs this loan as an opportunity to improve her condition at home.

loans.use: to buy pigs to continue her work

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 3 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is one of the members of the Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope) three person group. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country. They are micro entrepreneurs who are in clothing sales, sales of assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. Luisa is very excited about receiving her fourteenth loan from Esperanza International, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward her business growth.

Luisa lives in a simple home structure with her husband and with one of their two children. She says her most difficult challenge has been to rebuild her house. She enjoys reading and staying at home with her family. She started her business with the first loan she took from Esperanza. She runs a beauty salon and she has also been selling through a catalog, one of the leading brands of natural medicine. With this loan she will invest by buying hair and beauty products, natural medicine and others products. She will use the profits to reinvest in her businesses and to save for her family's needs, like to finish building her home with a safer structure. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair and beauty products, natural medicine and other products

loans.name: Htan To Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yasagyo township, this community currently has 30 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

A new loan would enable borrowers to buy quality chickpeas, sesame, pigeon peas, and millet seeds.  It would also cover the $10 per day in diesel fees that villagers must pay when hiring a tractor.  Villagers must lease tractors during planting and harvesting seasons because many of the young people that they would hire as laborers have migrated to the cities in search of employment.  To supplement farming incomes, some villagers weave fabrics and work as masons.

Pictured above are the committee members from the Htan Toe Village CBO: U Sein, U Htay, U Aung, U Htay and Daw Ohn. Included in the photo (middle) is 58- year-old U Sein, the father of five children. He purchased chickpea and pigeon pea seeds with his past loan and hopes to buy additional seeds with his new loan.

loans.use: to help 30 villagers buy quality crop inputs and diesel to power a tractor

loans.name: In Ma Htee Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Pale township, this community currently has 39 village customers, including 7 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

Due to inconsistent weather, villagers must find additional income sources to ensure that they have enough money to support the education and health of their families.  Some will therefore migrate to the cities or nearby mines in search of employment.  For those who stay in the village, livestock raising is a good opportunity.  Small pigs and goats can be purchased for $50 and sold back for $150, generating $100 in profit.  Additionally, manure from the animals can be used as natural fertilizer on the villagers' farms.

Pictured above are the committee members from in the Ma Htee Village CBO: U Tin, U Aye, U Thein, U Htay, Daw San, U Phoe, and U Pyay. Included in the photo (second from the right) is 45-year-old U Tin, the father of  six children. Two of them are still studying at school. He mainly grows sesame and cotton for his farm and also has a small grocery shop to generate extra income. He bought two small pigs with his previous loan and plans to buy two or three small goats with his new loan.

loans.use: to help 39 villagers buy livestock to raise and sell for a profit

loans.name: Koke Ko Su Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yasagyo township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.  Despite their struggles, they are very hospitable and work hard to support their neighbors.

Most villagers are farmers, growing mainly peanuts, beans, and groundnuts.  They require capital for fertilizer to enrich their crops and labor to make planting and harvesting easier.  To supplement crop sales, many families aspire to raise livestock, such as small pigs and goats.  The new loans will help them purchase animals to raise and sell back for a profit.  In addition to generating additional income, manure from the animals can be used as natural fertilizer.  As side businesses, villagers will also sell incense or snacks, generating, on average, $2 a day.

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U Pho, U Tin, U Aung, U Thein, and U Myo. Included in the photo is U Tin (second from the left), who is the father of two children. As his young daughter is still a student, he wants to invest his new loan in raising livestock so that this additional income can go towards his daughter's education.

loans.use: to help 29 villagers buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Yamile

texts.es:
Yamile es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Yamile y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Yamile is an enterprising young woman with a great desire to get ahead and progress in life.

For two years Yamile has been selling catalogue products, such as clothes, accessories, beauty products and household goods. She mainly sells these goods to friends, neighbours and relatives who know Yamile and who want her to move forward with her business.

Since she was a girl, Yamile has felt a great affinity for business and sales. She is now very skilled in this field thanks to her niceness and excellent service.

Yamile is applying for this loan in order to buy beauty products and clothes to increase her stock in improve sales. She will then earn a good income in order to help with household costs.

Yamile hopes to be able to prosper thanks to the support of good-hearted people who support these kinds of projects.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise, such as beauty products and clothes, to stock up her business and help out with household costs.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia  es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es madre soltera y día a día lucha por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como comerciante de papa en el Campo Ferial de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad y es muy amable y respetuosa con los clientes.
Yesenia en estos momentos quiere arreglar su vivienda para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así puedan tener una vida más cómoda. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá cumplir esa meta trazada y así poder empezar a construir su vivienda que ahora es prefabricada, y poder cumplir el sueño de su familia: "Tener su casa construida de material noble".
texts.en:
Yesenia is an enterprising young woman. She is 21 years old, single and lives with her family in Nazca.

Yesenia is somebody who has a great desire to get ahead. She is a single mother who every day fights to offer her family the best possible life. For over a year Yesenia has worked selling potatoes at the "Campo Ferial" market, in the local area. The work is going very well as Yesenia always offers good quality products and is very respectful and friendly with customers.

Yesenia wants to make repairs to her house in order to improve her family's quality of life and to have a more comfortable life. Yesenia is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, she will be able to achieve her goal, start building her home and achieve her family's dream of owning a house built with strong materials.

loans.use: to start building her home with stronger materials.

loans.name: Sonia Marleny

texts.es: Sonia de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y los dos hijos que juntos hab procreado:  una niña de 5 años y un varón de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 8 años se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir por encargo en su casa de habitación, los años de experiencia le han permitido que cada vez sean más los clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Sonia desea comprar una parcela colindante a su terreno, además deberá colocar un tapial para encerrar el terreno, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: una parcela de terreno y materiales para colocar un tapial y encerrar dicho terreno.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old and lives in a her own home with her husband and their two children.  Her daughter is five years old and her son is ten years old.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who for the past eight years has earned a living making clothing by order in her home.  Her years of experience have allowed her to continue to attract more customers.

Sonia wants to purchase a plot of land next to her property, as well as build a wall to enclose the land.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase a plot of land and the materials to build the retaining wall.

loans.use: purchase a plot of land and materials to build a wall to enclose the land.

loans.name: Kyu Chan Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Pale township, this community currently has 32 village customers, including 4 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.  Due to the lack of job opportunities in the village, some villagers will go to other countries, such as Thailand, as construction workers to support their families.  Others are forced to migrate to urban centers to become traders.  

Those who stay are mainly farmers who grow wheat, sunflowers, paddy, and various beans. Sesame and pigeon peas are the highest yielding crops for farmers. These farmers aspire to use their loans to buy agricultural inputs that will boost their crop yields and, therefore, their crop sales.  The villagers hope to use their additional crop income to mend the road in the village, as the poorly maintained road makes it difficult for people to travel to their farms and other cities. 

Pictured above are the committee members from Kyu Chan Village CBO: U Tin, U Win, U Sein, and U San. Included in the photo (farthest to the right) is 32-year-old U Tin, who is the father of two small children. He grows paddy, sesame, and beans and raises livestock to generate extra income for his family.  The new loan will help him to pay for seeds and fertilizer to enrich his crops.

loans.use: to help 32 villagers to purchase seeds for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, zippers, needles, etc.

loans.name: Rosalio Cristobal

texts.es: Rosalio de 37 años de edad vive con su con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 15, 11 y 7 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 8 años se gana la vida como motorista, actividad que realiza en los alrededores de su cantón. Rosalio desea  construir un muro de contención en los alrededores de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía un área de su vivienda está cercana a un barranco lo que  provoca inseguridad para su familia. Por lo anterior Rosalio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosalio is 37 years old and lives with his parents and their three children, who are 15, 11 and 7 years old each. Rosalio is a hard-working man who, for eight years, has made a living as a driver in the area around his canton. Rosalio wants to build a retaining wall around his home as, as can be seen in the photo, part of his home is near a riverbank, making it unsafe for his family. To build the wall, Rosalio is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars, and to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars, and to pay labourers to build a retaining wall in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Silvia Roxana

texts.es: Silvia de 38 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan, actualmente se dedica a la venta de lácteos como: queso fresco, requesón y crema, dicha venta la realiza 3 días por semana desde hace 8 años, de manera ambulante en los cantones cercanos. Silvia desea construir un baño con pila en su vivienda, además necesita reparar la puerta de entrada de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta se encuentra dañada. Por lo anterior Silvia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir una pila con baño, además de los materiales necesarios para reparar la puerta de su vivienda.
texts.en: Silvia is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and ten-year-old daughter. Silvia is a tenacious woman who has taken advantage of all opportunities in life. She currently makes a living selling dairy products such as fresh cheese, cottage cheese and cream. Silvia sells her goods three days per week and has been doing this work as a street vendor in the local cantons for eight years. Silvia wants to build a bathroom with a sink in her home. She also needs to repair the main door to her house as, as can be seen in the photo, it is damaged. Silvia is therefore applying for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy cement, sand, and iron bars to build a sink and bathroom. She will also buy the materials necessary to fix the door to her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and iron bars to build a sink and bathroom. She will also buy the materials necessary to fix the door to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the doors and windows that she wants to install in her home.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es: Blanca de 37 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 6 años y un varón de 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se desempeña como empleada de una pupuseria desde hace 4 años, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Blanca desea construir un baño con pila en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un baño con pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 37 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two children, a six-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old son.  She is a tenacious woman who has worked as an employee in a business making pupusas for the past four years.  This job has allowed her to get her two children ahead.

Blanca hopes to build a bathroom with a sink in her home, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron, as well as to pay for the labor needed to build the bathroom with a sink.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron, as well as pay for labor to build a bathroom with a sink in her home.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: Este es el Nuevo Grupo “Las Estrellitas” y está conformada por 05 socios optimistas dispuestos a comenzar a trabajar. Toribia de 55 años es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos balanceados para pollos como nicovita. Hace más de 02 años que Toribia se viene desempeñando en su negocio donde todo le va bien, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe. El deseo de Toribia es implementar una tienda de abarrotes, para así continuar educando a su hijo. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de nicovita y maíz. El nuevo grupo “Las Estrellitas” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Toribia es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
This is the "Las Estrellitas" (The Little Stars) group, a new group made up of five optimistic members who are committed to beginning to work.  

Toribia is 55 years old, she is separated and has 1 son who depends on her.  She works buying and selling balanced feed for chickens like Nicovita (a particular brand of animal feed).  Over two years ago, Toribia started working in this business, which has been going well for her thanks to the training that she has received.  Toribia's dream is to start a grocery store so that she can continue to educate her son.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan to purchase Nicovita and corn.  

The "Las Estrellitas" group is thankful for the people who have made this loan possible.  

Toribia is the second one on the left, and she is wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: purchase Nicovita (a brand of animal feed) and corn.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.en:
Jovanny is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor (Faith and Love) 3. This group is based around the city of La Romana, an area where the economy centers around the sugar cane industry and in which there is limited access to running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Here, Jovanny makes her home as a single mother with her two children.

Jovanny has proven herself to be a reliable associate of Esperanza and this will be her seventh loan, after having paid back her previous loans without problems. She is excited to take this loan to continue developing her underwear clothing business. With this loan she will buy all kinds of women's and men's underwear to increase her inventory and to resell them wholesale. She hopes to use the profits to continue investing in her business and to provide her children with what they need. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Tiefing

texts.fr:
TIEFING est un homme marié  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 9 enfants et vivant dans une  famille polygame à DJERA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien ses activités agricoles hivernale. 
Il est à son  4ème prêt avec l’institution, les 3 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de TIEFING, l’homme dans la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage  pour exploiter  5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 200.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Tiefing is a 37-year old married man. He is father to nine children and lives in a polygamous household in Djera, one of the villages in Boubouni, the third largest administrative region of Mali.  He works with the microfinance organization, Soro Yiriwaso, to better carry out his agricultural business during the rainy season.  He is on his fourth loan with the organization; the previous three loans were all fully repaid.  Tiefing grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy inputs and seeds, as well as pay for the labor costs of plowing and weeding five hectares of land.  After the harvest, the output will be sold at the village level, at the market, to a clientele of men and women.  He expects to earn a profit of 200,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and pay for his household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and to pay the labor costs of plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 1 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TABAKOROLE, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  5ème prêt avec l’institution, les 4 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de KARIA L, la 2 ème femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en: The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 32. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Tabakorole, one of the villages in Bougouni, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan; the previous four loans were all fully repaid. Karia, standing second from right to left in the photo, grows groundnuts.  With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and to pay for the labor costs and weeding of one hectare of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in the market, to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 100,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the labor costs of plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her chickens. Arlene has been raising chicken for 3 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her chickens.

loans.name: Genesis 3 Group

texts.en:
Carlixta is the coordinator of her group, Genesis 3, and her group is located in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Carlixta is excited to be seeking her 14th loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She operates a Beauty Salon, and she will invest in her business by buying a hairdryer and hair products to sell to her clients and apply these products when they come to her salon. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. Her most difficult challenge is managing to have a comfortable life. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer, hair products and other items

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 1 est constitué de 9 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEKOUMALA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  5ème prêt avec l’institution, les 4 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  riz est la spéculation cultivée de KARIDIA, la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2,5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 290.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en: The nine members of the Benkadi 1 Group are married women with an average age of 45. They have an average of four children and all live in polygamous families in Tiekoumala, one of the villages in Bougouni, the third largest administrative region in Mali. The women work with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better operate their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan; the previous four loans were all fully repaid. Karidia, standing second from left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy inputs and seeds and to pay for the labor costs and weeding of 2.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level, in the market, to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 290,000 FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as help her husband with their household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and to pay for labor costs and weeding.

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 13, 9 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 10 años se dedica  a la venta de productos por catálogo, logrando gracias a su experiencia que cada vez sean más los clientes que solicitan sus productos. Rosa desea invertir en la instalación de energía eléctrica y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, es por ello que, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para pagar derecho de instalación de energía eléctrica y comprar lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda
texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and lives with her spouse and their three children, ages 13, 9 and 3.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who for the past 10 years, has worked selling products via catalogs.  Thanks to her experience, she has been able to continue to attract more customers who seek out her products.  Rosa wishes to install electricity in her home and replace the roof of her home.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to pay for the installation of electricity and to purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood to replace the room of her home.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood, as well as pay for the installation of electricity in her home.

loans.name: Menchita

texts.en:
Menchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 50000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Menchita has been in this business for 40 years. Menchita earns additional income from raising pigs.

Menchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 64 years old and married with one child.

Salome works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Salome has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 11 years, and she also earns income from selling bananas.

Salome aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is an ambitious young woman. She is currently employed full-time. At the end of her busy day, she travels to her second job, a part-time commercial cleaning company that she owns. She is registered as a minority business owner and is working to get additional commercial contracts to grow her business.

Jennifer's dream is to operate her cleaning company as a full-time business owner. In order to realize that dream she needs to purchase the equipment that will allow her to service her current customers faster and more efficiently while also pursuing larger commercial contracts. 

With a loan of $2,650 Jennifer will be able to purchase equipment necessary to build that capacity. This is a step forward towards her dream.

loans.use: To buy equipment that will increase the capacity of her cleaning business to provide services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops in the upcoming season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 54 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 nietos de 15 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 20 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan en su vivienda, además su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo de jornalero. Ana desea construir un cuarto de habitación en su vivienda, razón por la cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un cuarto de habitación en su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is 54 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their two grandchildren, aged 15 and 9. She is an enterprising woman who has sold bread for 20 years. In addition, her life's companion contributes to the family budget thanks to his work as a day laborer. Ana wants to build a bedroom  in her house. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron. In addition, she has to pay for labor costs to build the bedroom in her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron. In addition, she will pay for labor costs to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 42 years old, married, and has nine children, four of whom attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She earns additional income from selling fruit.
 
Luzminda requested a loan from NWTF for 24,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of feeds and vitamins. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stcks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married and has six children. She works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling charcoal.  

Margarita requested her 18th loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eloisa Ester

texts.es: Eloísa de 51 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo de 18 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de diversidad de pan dulce, actividad que realiza en su cantón, además su esposo le apoya en la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. Eloísa desea construir un muro y reparar el techo de su vivienda, para lo cual, solicita  un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, lámina y polines para construir un muro y reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Eloísa is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and their 18 year old son. She is a tenacious woman who for 3 years has sold a variety of sweet breed.  She does this activity in her canton. In addition, her husband supports the family through his work. Eloísa wants to build a wall and repair the roof on her house. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, laminated sheeting and rods to build a wall and repair the roof on her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, gravel, laminated sheeting and rods to build a wall and repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Teresita requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She buys and sells scrap materials in the Philippines. She earns additional income from her general store.

Analiza requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more scrap materials to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Sophal, 44, is an experienced and industrious farmer. She is a lovely mother of one married child and one adolescent who is enrolling in a local high school. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 4 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years.

To keep her rice growing well and be more fruitful, Sophal is going to use natural fertilizer on her farmland. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizer to use in her farming process during this farming season. 

With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her rice growing better and provide more benefit to her.  She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria is 45 years old and lives in Salvador, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

Eneria has a photography, lamination, and photocopy business business and earns approximately 7,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for buying a new photocopy machine.

Eneria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda  is a businesswoman from Ozamiz. She is 58 years old, married, and has an expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Luzviminda  is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. 

Now she applied for a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

She continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nenita hopes to have her own place for her business. She wants to have her own car, house and lot, and to manage a bigger business. She meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Herminia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. 

Herminia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Herminia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marina has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food vending.

In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food vending

loans.name: Enaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Enaida una mujer que carga una gran responsabilidad la cual es mantener a su familia, padres, y 3 hijos que durante su juventud tuvo. 

Trabaja en una tienda que monto con mucho esfuerzo muy humilde pero que presta un servicio no único pero si poco visto en una vereda la cual es una tienda de dulces para que los niños y porque no padres compren y disfruten de algo diferente a lo encontrado normalmente frutos y verduras que producen.
Su idea ha sido muy aceptada por el público y debido a esto se encuentra con ganas y motivación de solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía para satisfacer a sus clientes y seguir creciendo para apoyar y mantener a su número familia. 
Su sueño es seguir adelante con sus proyecto tener una casa, tener ganado, progresar y triunfar como emprendedora y empresaria.
texts.en:
Enaida is a woman who carries a great responsibility, which is supporting her family, parents and 3 children that she had had in her youth. 

She works in a  store that she opened with a lot of hard work. It is very humble but it offers a service that isn't unique but is rarely seen on the sidewalk. It is a candy store so that children, and why not, their parents, can buy and enjoy something different than the normal fruits and vegetables they produce. 

Her idea has been well accepted by the public and because of this, she is very eager and motivated to ask for a loan to buy merchandise to meet her customers' demands and keep growing to support her big family. 
 
Her dream is to continue forward with her project to have a house, cattle, and to triumph as an enterprising business woman.

loans.use: to buy a variety of candies and french fry bags to sell on the sidewalk.

loans.name: Hakh

texts.en:
Hakh, 64, who is a lovely mother of one dependent child and four married children, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. In the last 36 years, she has been involving in a farming business. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells the product to the local dealers and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

Hakh wants to buy one more farmland to operate a farming business, as she normally does on her own land. Due to the shortage of money, she would like get a Kiva loan to buy farmland. 

With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can receive more a double benefit increase as she has two farmlands. She also thanks to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for 15 years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by managing a computer shop business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She will also used a portion of the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her computer units.

In the future, Elisa dreams of growing her business, and becoming successful through all her hard work. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Devah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Devah works hard to support her family. She has a internet cafe business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. 

Devah is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional computer unit as well as pay the electric and internet bills for her internet cafe business.

Devah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer unit and pay the electric and internet bills for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 62 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell. Virginia has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Marina has been in this business for 16 years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy meat, chicken, fish, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business. Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years and earns more income from pig fattening.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josita works hard to support her family. She has a selling coconut lumber business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.
