Josita is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of coconut lumber to sell.

Josita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of coconut lumber to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sylvia has been in this business for 35 years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish, ice, and plastic bags.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish, ice, and plastic bags

loans.name: Ferlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ferlie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ferlie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Ferlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie joined Paglaum MPC in 2010 when she learned that PMPC extends financial assistance to microentrepreneurs like her. 

As a businesswoman in Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan for her rice retailing business. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Elsie feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase more bags of rice to sell. Elsie wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: David De Jesus

texts.es: David de 31 años de edad vive con su hija de 2 años de edad, su madre y dos sobrinos. Él es un  hombre tenaz que desde hace 2 años se gana la vida trabajando cerca de su localidad, además su esposa tuvo que emigrar para tratar de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. David desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: David is 31 and lives with his 2-year-old daughter, his mother and two nephews. He is a determined man who has earned his living for the past two years working in the area where he lives. His wife had to emigrate in order to try to improve their family's living conditions. David wants to change the roof of his house and is therefore asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheeting, roofing supports and fasteners.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheeting, roofing supports and fasteners to change the roof of his house

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda has always dreamed of opening her own body massage shop to support her two children. She used her loan to buy liniments, lotions and powder  for body massage. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: To buy liniments, lotions and powder for body massage.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 51, is from the village of Lopez Jaena Zamboanga del Sur. James lives with his live-in partner and has one child. 

He has been doing vehicle repairs for many years and it sustains their living. Recently, James joined GDMPC and he gained access to financial services. He was happy to think that it will help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He took a new loan to buy an electrical transformer used for his welding machine. He wants to have a better living in the near future with his family.

loans.use: to buy electrical transformer for his welding machine.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. Nida has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn, 42, who is a lovely mother of one dependent child and four married children, lives in a small community of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in a farming business for nearly 20 years. In her farm land, she grows rice and sells the product to the local dealers, and sometimes she sells directly to customers at the market. 

To accelerate her farming process in this season, she would like to hire some laborers to help her to transplant the rice. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to pay for hiring laborers. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can shorten her transplanting time and get the crop earlier than the expected time. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita runs a tailoring business and made good use of a previous loan to buy the materials she needs to do her work. She has been in this line of work for six years, and she shares her responsibilities with her husband.

She is requesting a new loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional supplies such as fabric, cloth and thread. The profits she earns from this loan will help her meet her daily needs. She is grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders.

Juanita hopes to open up branches soon. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Maxima Kaye

texts.en:
Maxima Kaye is a responsible mother who operates in motorcycle transport to help her husband in sustaining the necessities of her family. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to become successful in the future. 

To strengthen her business, Maxima Kaye wants to access financial assistance from the Kiva lenders in an amount of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be continuously using her motorcycle and providing a better service to her passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for her motorcycle

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconut. Nilda is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 32 years old and has two children. Melona is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

Melona is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Melona requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melona has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Melona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: José de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 9 años se gana la vida trabajando como ordenanza en un centro escolar de su localidad, además su esposa aporta a los gastos económicos del hogar gracias a su venta de dulces artesanales. José desea construir un muro perimetral a media altura, con malla ciclón en la parte superior, el cual, colocará alrededor de su propiedad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y malla ciclón para construir un muro alrededor de su propiedad.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife. He is a hard-working man who for nine years has earned a living working as an orderly in a school center in town.  His wife also helps with the household financial expenses thanks to her sale of handmade sweets.

José wishes to build a perimeter wall of average height with chicken wire at the top, which he would place around his property. For this reason he asks for a loan from FUSAI to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel, and chicken wire in order to build the wall around his property.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, and chicken wire in order to build a wall around his property.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos de 39 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 8 años y un varón de 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 10 años se gana la vida como encargado de proyectos en su localidad. Carlos desea construir un muro frente a su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo, además deberá pagar mano de obra para construir un muro frente a su vivienda y así lograr darle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is 39 years old. He lives with his life companion and their 2 children, an 8 year-old girl and a 11 year-old boy. He is a hardworking man who has 10 years as a project manager in his area. Carlos wants to build a wall in front of his housing which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick and also to pay for manual labor to construct a wall in front of his home to be able to give better security to his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick and to pay for manual labor to construct a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to use the loan to purchase more quantities of dried fish for her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to pay for dried fish to expand her product inventory. The more dried fish displayed at her stall, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Felisa hopes that her business will continue to progress for she wants to give her children a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Edisson Jhoel

texts.es:
Edisson es un joven soltero, de 20 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, en sus tiempos libres le gusta ver películas y en ocasiones ayuda a su mamá a preparar ceviche. Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja como Diseñadora Gráfico en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien porque tiene un buen desempeño en el trabajo y siempre actúa con ética.
Edisson está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para amoblar su habitación y así poder dormir de manera más cómoda. Gracias a esto seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Edisson is 20 years old and single.  He lives in Ica with his family.  He is a person with a great desire to get ahead.  In his free time he likes to watch movies, and he sometimes helps his mother make ceviche.

For some time he has been working as a graphic designer for a prestigious company.  It is going very well for him because of his good work performance.  He always acts ethically.

Edisson is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have provided, he will be able to buy a bedroom set to furnish his room.  This way he will be able to sleep more comfortably.  Thanks to this, he will continue putting forth great effort to be able to get his family ahead and to provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more vegetables for business purposes. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also manages a direct-selling business, and she earns additional profit from it.

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia hopes to improve and grow her business more. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 30 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old married and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. 

Irene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 61 years old and married with ten children.

Leonarda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Leonarda has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Leonarda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 34 years old and married with three children. With her children currently in school, Lea works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like snack foods, canned goods, biscuits, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell. Lea has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 52 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Lanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lanie requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Lanie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lanie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 54 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sweet corn. Rachel is borrowing 28,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetables business.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 49 years old, is married and lives with her husband. To have additional income, she is engaged in a hog-raising business. Adelaida loves to raise animals. She is a very caring person, most especially with her family. She makes sure that she can meet all the needs of her family. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy feed and vitamins for her business. In the future, Adelaida hopes that she can expand her business so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Espero

texts.en:
Espero is married and has three children.

He operates a transportation business while his wife works vending fish in the market for a living. Fifteen years of running a transportation business has  helped his family a lot, he says. 

He realizes that his membership in GDMPC gives access to microfinance services that can help them augment their living. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy sidecar for his motorcycle, used in the transportation service. 

This photo was taken with his fishing boat. In the future, he wants to have a better living with his family.

loans.use: to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been engaged in buying and selling medicines and other merchandise products for more than seven years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Rose is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional merchandise to sell to expand her product inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Rose still desires to give her children a good and quality education. She also hopes that her business will keep on growing and flourishing. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional medicine and other products needed in her businesses.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 63 years old and married with seven children. 

Marcela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcela requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Marcela has been raising livestock for 13 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marcela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 33 years old and single with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and other groceries.

Vanessa has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish from another town, Guajira.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to maintain his business

loans.name: Edwin Oswaldo

texts.es: Edwin de 33 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 10, 6 y 1 año de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que al ver la necesidad de una venta de productos de primera necesidad y una venta de tortillas en su caserío, decidió aprovechar dicha necesidad y colocar su pequeño negocio por lo que desde hace 5 años se gana la vida gracias a la venta de tortillas y productos de primera necesidad, su compañera de vida lo apoya elaborando las tortillas que serán vendidas en el negocio. Edwin desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para invertir en: arroz, azúcar, maíz, golosinas, cal, pan dulce, etc. y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Edwin is 33 years old and lives with his life partner and their 3 children ages 1, 6, and 10 years old. He is a very entrepreneurial man and seeing the need of the sale of basic needs products and tortillas in his village, he decided to take advantage of this need and start his small business which he has now been doing for 5 years thanks to the sale of staples and tortillas. His life companion helps him make the tortillas that are sold in the business. Edwin wants to invest in his business by requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in rice, sugar, corn, candy, lime, sweetbread, etc. and thereby improve his business.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, corn, candy, lime, sweetbread, etc.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 35 years old and married with three children.

Cristy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

Cristy has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from farming rice. Cristy has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Cristy aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Ruth

texts.pt:
A senhora Ruth  é comerciante, casada mãe de 6 filhos dos quais apenas um ainda a estudar os restantes  vive na casa própria e  sustenta sua sogra e um enteado.
Com valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, pedra, varrões para a construção de sua casa 
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar  a sua obra,  fazer aviarios  para criacao de frangos como forma de reforcar sua renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros para a conclusão de sua casa, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano e agradeceria se a Hluvuku introduzisse servico de poupanca.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth is a trader and a married mother of 6, one of whom is still in school. She lives in a house she owns and also supports her mother-in-law and a stepson.

With this loan she will buy cement, sand, stone and rods for the construction of her house.

Her dreams are to finish building her home and to build aviaries to begin raising chickens as a way of reinforcing her family's income.

She says the main challenges she has faced around finishing the construction of her home are financial ones and that she will request further loans to make her plans a reality. She would be grateful to Hluvuku if they could start a savings scheme.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, stone and rods for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Like her mother, Jenny became a vendor, peddling snacks and fruits on the streets and markets here. Her  regular customers include travellers and students who buy fruits from her, and this helps out when her family’s finances are low. 

Currently, Jenny has joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services of the cooperative. She has taken a loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. In the future, she is hoping to build a store in the market where she can sell more.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell

loans.name: Xiomara Lisseth

texts.es: Xiomara de 29 años de edad vive con sus padres y un tío. Ella es una joven emprendedora que desde hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de plátanos, actividad que realiza en su cantón y gracias  a la cual logra apoyar a sus padres con la economía familiar. Xiomara desea mejorar sus ventas y ganancias en el negocio por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en sus plantaciones de plátano y así lograr mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Xiomara is 29 years old and lives with her parents and her uncle. She is a young entrepreneur and has been in the cultivation and sale of bananas for 5 years, an activity she does in her town and thanks to which she is able to support her parents with the family expenses. Xiomara wants to improve her sales and profits in the business such that she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in her banana plantation and to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to invest in the banana plantations for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
Ma. Teresita is a 43-years-old married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.   

Ma. Teresita has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

Ma. Teresita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Teresita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 35 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Bebita has been in this business for 2 years. Bebita also earns more income from raising pigs.

Bebita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de 43 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos de 16, 10 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su domicilio, gracias a este negocio logra mantener la economía familiar. Concepción desea mejorar las ventas de su negocio, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz y cal  y poder así contar con los insumos necesarios para ofrecer las deliciosas tortillas a sus clientes y poder así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Concepción is 43 years old and single mother. She lives with her three children, who are 16, 10 and 7 years old each. Concecpión is an enterprising woman who, for five years, has made a living selling tortillas at her home. Thanks to this business, she is able to keep the household afloat. Concecpión wants to increase sales at her business. She is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in corn and lime and have the necessary supplies for her tortilla business. She can then continue to sell delicious tortillas to her customers and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to invest in corn and lime for her business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in goods such as achiote, mustard, pastas, peanuts, cloves, pepper and cumin.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 61 years old and married to Rogelio. They live in Isabela, a small rural area, together with their seven children. 

Julieta is engaged in a tailoring business situated near in their home. Her business supplements her husband's income from farming. She has been in this kind of business for ten years and she was glad that business is still doing well. 

Julieta is requesting for a loan of PHP 20,000 that she plans to use to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. 

Her dream for her family is to overcome their poor living situation.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own rug-making business for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her child with a better education. 

To improve her profits, Marites would like to apply for a new loan. With PHP 10,000, she can purchase more raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She sincerely sends her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Marites hopes to improve her family's living conditions and to give her children a better education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cloth, thread, and other materials for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the roof of his home.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sabina works hard to support her family.

Sabina has a dry goods selling business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising livestock. Sabina is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell in her business.

Sabina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Nida has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Ma. Nida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business and make repairs to her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Connie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. 

Connie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. Connie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Marilou is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years.

Marilou requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Melefe

texts.en:
Melefe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Melefe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, etc. for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Melefe dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, etc. for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Juana works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Juana is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetables business.

Juana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma is 42 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Gelma is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gelma has been pig fattening for 7 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove and supplies like rice, bananas, brown sugar, oil, meats, vegetables, grains in general and fruits.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia de 51 años de edad vive con su hija y dos nietos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 8 años se gana la vida gracias a la venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza en su cantón. Antonia desea mejorar su negocio, es por ello que desea comprar ingredientes por mayoreo lo que le permitiría tener mayores ganancias. Por lo anterior Antonia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz y cal, para su negocio de venta de tortillas.
texts.en: Antonia is 51 years old and lives with her daughter and two grandchildren. Antonia is an enterprising woman. For eight years she has earned a living selling tortillas in her local area. Antonia wants to improve her business and so wants to buy ingredients in bulk, allowing her to earn higher profits. Antonia is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in corn and lime for her business selling tortillas.

loans.use: to invest in corn and lime for her business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, metal sheeting and wood in order to build a sink and repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Emerma

texts.en:
Emerma has been earning a living from selling fish for many years to sustain her living. She used her previous loans from GDMPC to buy new fishing nets. She successfully repaid her previous loans, and from her investments got a good return in revenue.

To improve her business, Emerma wants to buy a foam chest to use for storing more fish to sell in order to increase sales. With this current loan, her plan would be possible. 

In the future, Emerma wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a foam chest to be used for storing more fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 45, has a shop in the community of Paragu, where she lives with her partner and their four children. In the shop she sells retail items like groceries, snacks, soda, meat, dairy, etc. which she buys wholesale at the best deals in the town where she lives. The business is run by Victoria from 6 am to 9 pm every day, selling items on credit, and more commonly, for cash. Her main customers are housewives and in general, neighbors, who buy retail items and products that they need for household consumption. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 12,000, with which she plans to increase the stock in her store, buying discounted products (staple items) like rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar, milk, etc. that will help her to have an assorted inventory and to manage competitive prices.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar and milk for her store.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a 52-year-old farmer who is hardworking and humble. This has allowed him to progress and today he has rice crops. 

With the support of this loan, he will purchase agricultural supplies like manure, pesticide, fertilizers, and other things. With these supplies, he will continue to care for his crops so that he will have a better and more productive harvest, which will allow him to increase his income when he sells his products.

Rafael, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength, and tenacity, would like to continue fighting to achieve his dream, which is to have his own farm where he can grow a better variety of products and improve the profitability of his business. This will provide economic stability so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies like manure, pesticide, fertilizers, and other things

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending.  

Serena requested her 24th loan from NWTF for 21,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items for her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Carmenia

texts.en:
Carmenia is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Carmenia requested her fourth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more sacks of rice for sell for her rice retailing business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for sell

loans.name: Rosly

texts.en:
Rosly is 42 years old and widowed, with six children. Rosly works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like noodles, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, coffee, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Rosly has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like noodles, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, coffee, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cam

texts.en:
Cam would like to take a further loan to buy a greater variety of soft drinks for selling from her stall. 

Cam's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of soft drinks for selling

loans.name: Mui

texts.en:
Mui would like to take a further loan to buy salt and fruit to sell in her store. 

Mui's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy salt and fruit to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rebeca Maria

texts.es:
Rebeca es una joven estudiante de Ingeniería Civil, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Soy Rebeca, tengo 19 años de edad, vivo en Casa de Alto, una zona rural de Pimentel, Provincia San Francisco de Macoris.
Soy la última de cuatro hermanos, quienes vivimos con mi abuela desde temprana edad, ya que nuestra madre falleció y mi padre no tiene un trabajo estable que le permita mantenernos a ninguno de nosotros, porque lo poco que consigue es por trabajos informales.
Quiero estudiar en la Universidad Católica Nordestana (UCNE). La cual queda ubicada en San Francisco De Macorís y un poco retirada del lugar donde vivo, mi deseo es estudiar Ing. Civil ya que gusta esa carrera y todo lo relacionado a las construcciones y dirigir obras y además soy hábil con los números.
 llevo un semestre en la universidad ya que con mucho esfuerzo yo pude conseguir media beca (50%) pero no tengo como costear la otra parte ni los gastos de las universitarios.
 Necesito este préstamo porque yo no tengo el dinero suficiente para hacer una carrera profesional, este préstamo tocaría en gran manera mi vida ya que podría estudiar y hacerme profesional, ser mejor persona en la mañana y serviría de ejemplo para otras personas de que si tú te esfuerzas y tocas puertas se pueden hacer posibles tus sueños.
 Mis metas académicas son hacerme profesional para tener y darle a mi abuela una mejor calidad de vida y así poder ayudar a jóvenes que al igual que yo no tienen recursos para estudiar pero si un gran anhelo y deseo, después que termine mi carrera quiero ejercerla y desearía en un futuro poner mi propia empresa de construcción donde daría empleo a estudiantes recién graduados para así de alguna forma poder ayudarlo de igual forma como yo espero que lo hagan  conmigo.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a young woman studying Civil Engineering. She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her tuition fees. This is her story:

“My name is Rebeca, I am nineteen years old and I live in Casa de Alto, a rural community in Pimentel, which belongs to the province of San Francisco de Macorís. I am the youngest of four siblings and we have all been living with my grandmother since we were very young because our mother died and my father does not have a stable job and cannot support us. The little money he earns comes from informal jobs.

I would like to study at the Universidad Católica Nordestana (UCNE), which is located in San Francisco de Macorís, a bit far from where I live. I would like to study Civil Engineering, because I love that profession and everything related to buildings and construction works. Besides, I am good with numbers.

I have been studying for six months now, since I received a scholarship thanks to my great efforts. However, I am not able to pay for the remaining expenses. I need this loan because I do not have enough money to finish my professional studies. This loan would have a great influence on my life because I would be able to become a professional and become a better person who can be an example for other people in the future, teaching them that in order to make one’s dreams come true, one must work hard and knock on some doors.

My goals are to become a professional in order to improve my and my grandmother’s living conditions. Also, to be able to help other young people like me who do not have the resources to study but really want to do so. After finishing my studies, I want to work as an engineer and my dream is to have my own construction company in the future. I would be able to employ newly graduated students and give them my hand, in the same way that, I hope, I will be given one.”

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It is a 42-year-old woman lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three dependant children who are enrolled in a primary school in the village. 

To make a living, It manages and operates a rice farm located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this career for twenty four years. With great effort and hard work, she is able to make USD 4.00 per day.

It wants energy for her home at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Due to inadequate funds, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. 

She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is a highly skilled farmer with experience in various areas of agriculture. He has an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. He has a small crop of rice that he tends to every day from the early hours of the morning. Currently he lives alone, and the money that he makes goes toward his sustainability and the sustainability of his harvest. He has been able to survive with great effort.

He wants to kick-start his harvest and earn a better income. Thus he is asking for financial assistance to invest in farming supplies such as fertilizer, irrigation, and pesticide. Additionally, he will buy rice seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to have a better quality product. His biggest dream is to have his own house and have a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a retail rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice for her business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Bebiana works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables. Bebiana is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

Bebiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. 

With this loan he intends to purchase fertilizers, fungicides, to hire laborers to help with his rice farming, and to buy a variety of seedling plants that are suited to the soil and climate conditions of the area. With these investments he aims to increase the density of plants per area, thereby improving production, while taking advantage of good soil fertility, climate conditions, and other favorable conditions for cultivation. With these improvements to the crop, he expects to increase his income, and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, to hire laborers to help with his rice farming, and to buy a variety of seedling plants that are suited to the soil and climate conditions of the area.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from five years to fifteen years. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. 

Pamela will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy additional stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a quality life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay bills and expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 2 children with ages 15 years and 25 years. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a bakery where he bakes cakes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of storage facilities to preserve cakes. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a refrigerator to store the cakes. 

His business goal is to be able to produce more snacks within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards and expand the business. 

This is his second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for four years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Maria Victoria would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Maria Victoria wants to improve her profits and grow her business. She also hopes always to be happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Neslie

texts.en:
Neslie previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Neslie hopes to become successful both in business and in life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Toda independiente tiene como sueño hacer crecer su negocio honestamente y este es el sueño que persigue cada día la señora María quien tiene como lema que cada día es una oportunidad de progresar y creer que la empresa esta bien es decir que no hay oportunidad de crecer. 

María es una mujer de 49 años de edad con dos hijos de 16 y 23 años de edad dedica a la confección a terceros, luchadora y muy aguerrida con uan gran cualidad de que cuando se queda sin trabajo busca y busca par ano quedarse sin que hacer.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como tela, hilos, agujas, broches, remaches para su taller para tener existencias para algún trabajo.
texts.en:
To be independent is like a dream and make your business grow honestly. This is the dream that María follows every day. Her motto is that each day is an opportunity to progress. If your business is good that means that you have no room to grow.

María is a 49 year old woman with two children aged 16 and 23. She sews for third parties. She is dedicated and brave with the great quality of finding work when she does not have work. If you look for work for a year you end up doing nothing. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread, needles, clasps and rivets for her workshop to have stock for her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles clasps and rivets.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is 58 years old and married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Milagrosa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Milagrosa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Milagrosa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional basket of dried fish to sell for her business.

Flora has been in this business for 9 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  Flora dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ernita is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ernita has been raising pigs for 10 years and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is 58 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Feliza has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from live fish culture.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him finance his rice seedlings.

He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders a month later than planned because his buyers didn’t give him his money on time. He is extremely sorry for this. With the profits, Ariel was able to save some money for the building of his own house.

He approaches ASKI MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seedlings so he can continue rice production and save more for his future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure for his banana crops.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 53 years old and is married with four children. Marisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Marisa has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Marisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dariljef

texts.en:
Dariljef is a farmer. He is 34 years old, hard-working, and modest. From a young age he learned all about farm work, thanks to what his parents taught him.

This has allowed him to move forward in life and today he owns a plot of land where he grows rice, an activity he does every day. The harvests he collects are sold in the market plaza of the municipality. In addition, he works as a day laborer in various farms in the region. With this, he supplements his income with which he looks out for the well-being of his parents, who struggled so much to raise him.

Dariljef, with his enterprising spirit, drive, and tenacity, wants to continue striving to fulfill his dream of having his own farm where he can grow a  greater variety of products and this way improve the profitability of his business. This will ensure economic stability so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and seed

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad owns and operates a general store to earn her living. Her husband is a fisherman, and her store helps to support his income from fishing. 

With her generated income, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC micro finance. She takes this new loan to buy foam containers to store soft drinks. 

In the future, she wants to expand the store and ensure a better source of income. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy foam containers to store soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for materials needed to repair jewelry.

loans.name: Edelie

texts.en:
Edelie previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan  to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edelie hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. She wants to see her family happy and content. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52, married and has nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   She has a vegetables business in the Philippines. 

Rebecca requests a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 54 years old and is married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Araceli has been in this business for 34 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Araceli is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.


She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en: Huong is 52 years old and lives with two children and her husband. For the past 5 years Huong has been running a shop selling breads and pork to earn an income to support her family. She is the group leader of a 6-member loan group, who live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the middle wearing a striped jacket. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Huong is requesting a loan to purchase better-quality foods and breads to sell from her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy breads and pork to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is married with two children. She peddles fish in their village while her husband does fishing for a living. This is their main source of income and they have been doing this for many years. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy new fishing nets used for fishing. In the future, the couple wants to own a stall in the market, in town, where they could sell fish. She wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Sylviah

texts.en: Sylviah is a married woman. She has two children, ages 6 and 8 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate storage space. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a variety of groceries within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40, married and the mother of three. 

She helps her husband in generating income through hog-raising. She aims to make it profitable in order to earn a higher income and support the education of her children. She planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to ask for financial assistance from KIVA lenders an amount of PHP12,000.00 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. 

She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda  has been operating her own retail store for many years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

A big family requires more effort to provide for the needs of her five children. The couple has to work hard and with determination to improve their income in order to provide their children with a better education. Her husband had a tailoring business, too. 

To increase sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Linda hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more stocks of LPG tanks needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of LPG tanks needed in her business. The more products displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufrocina hopes that her business will continue to progress and help with their everyday expenses. She dreams to improve their general living condition and hopes that her family will always be healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of LPG (gas) tanks to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Vivian Andrea

texts.es:
Vivian desde muy joven ha mostrado gran pasión por el comercio y un deseo de independencia de tener un medio productivo para ser auto sostenible, vive junto con su madre la cuál con sui negocio ayuda y apoya en todas las cuentas del hogar como servicios públicos, arrendamiento, alimentación y está pagando su educación.
Se dedica a la venta de productos, bebidas, y abarrotes con lo que le ha ido muy bien pues vende al x mayor y también por unidad, tiene ubicado su negocio en su hogar y solicita un crédito para la compra de vitrinas y estanterías para mejorar su presentación y también comprara variedad en bebidas para traer líquidos únicos en su región, tanto naturales como procesados. 

Su sueño es tener un local comercial y vender a tiendas al x mayor y sacar a su madre del trabajo que descanse y disfrute su vida.
texts.en:
Vivian has shown a passion for business since she was quite young and a desire to be independent having a means of production in order to be self-sufficient. She lives with her mother and with her business she helps and supports all the household expenses like utilities, rent, food and paying her education.

She works selling products, drinks and groceries and has been doing well. She sells wholesale and also by the unit. Her business is located in her house, She is requesting a loan to buy display cases and shelves to improve her presentation and also to have a variety of drinks to offer the liquids that are unique to her area both natural as well as processed. Her dream is to have commercial location and sell to stores wholesale and free her mother from working so she can relax and enjoy life.

loans.use: to buy display cases and shelves and also to buy a variety of natural and processed drinks.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TABAKOROLE, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  5ème prêt avec l’institution, les 4 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide  est la spéculation cultivée de BINTOU, la 3ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2,5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 230.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 group is made up of ten married women, who average 40 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Tabakorole, one of the villages of Bougouni, Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their winter farming activities without any problems. They are on their fifth loan from the institution and the four previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Bintou, who is standing third from the left in the photo, grows groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy seeds and pay for labor and hoeing of 2.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village, at the market, to a customer base made up of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 230,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and help out her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor and hoeing.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.ru: Gerald is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of market prices. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.
texts.en:
Gerald is a married man and has 2 children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area with potential for business growth and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of market prices. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is diligent mother who buys and resells fruits and vegetables within the rural community. Due to financial hardship, she wants to make her business profitable and generates sufficient income to sustain the daily necessities of her family. 

Having  inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP50,000.00 to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and soft brooms to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will help her improve the business as well as their state of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and soft brooms to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 5 children, ranging from 17 to 37 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bricks. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business growth and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs for the bricks. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy brick making equipment. Her business goal is to have a business that can provide bricks in a timely manner for clients within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy brick making equipment

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan started the business four years ago and is asking for a loan  to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale. This will allow her to keep her business open in order to continue serving more variety to satisfy her customers'  tastes and needs. This loan will result in higher sales and a higher income for Joan.

Joan tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working at her cafeteria, offering better service to her customers. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
Novel previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. Novel also manages and operates a tricycle unit and distributes water to her regular customers.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Novel appears here in a photo with her tricycle unit.

Novel desires to own and manage a jeepney unit which will also be used for transportation service. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Vivian is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been farming vegetables for 4 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 57 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Nenita would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 27 years old and single.
