Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Edna has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Edna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional baskets of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Arlyn has been in this business for 10 years. Arlyn earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est constitué de 9 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEKOUMALA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  5ème prêt avec l’institution, les 4 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée de SALIMATA, la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour  et de sarclage pour exploiter  1,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 130.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 group is made up of nine married women, who average 34 years of age with four children each; they all live in polygamous families in Tiekoumala, one of the villages of Bougouni, Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their winter farming activities smoothly. They are on their fifth loan from the institution and the four previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Salimata, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan she is planning to buy inputs and seeds,  and also pay for labor and hoeing of 1.75 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village, at the market, to a customer base made up of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 130,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and help out her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for inputs and seeds, and pay for labor and hoeing.

loans.name: Djiguiya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA 1 est constitué de 9 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5  enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à BLADIE, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Ils sont à leur  3ème prêt avec l’institution, les 2 prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de LAMINE, le 2ème homme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  3 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 450.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  de gerer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya 1 group is made up of nine married men, who average 36 years of age with five children each; they all live in polygamous families in Bladie, one of the villages of Bougouni, Mali's third administrative region. They collaborate with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can carry out their winter farming activities smoothly. They are on their third loan from the institution and the two previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Lamine, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows corn. With his loan he is planning to buy inputs and seeds,  and also pay for labor and hoeing of three hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village, at the market, to a customer base made up of men and women.

He expects to make a profit of 450,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and manage his family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for labor and hoeing.

loans.name: Elgena

texts.en:
To support her family, Elgena earns money from her farm and her pottery business. For many years, farming has sustained the needs of the family. Improving her business is her passion for she wants to ensure better source of income for the family in the near future. She wants to provide them good and comfortable living they don't experienced before. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy clay mix for her pottery business. Her previous loans used for both farm and business was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy clay mix for her pottery business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma has been in Barangay (township), Paragu since she was born. She is happily married to Mario, a corn and rice farmer. She and Mario have four children. They have an average level of living.

Thelma is thankful that through her business, she was able to send all of her children to school and they finished their studies. Although her children have graduated from college, she wants to maintain her store for them to have a stable source of income to provide for their needs. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 that she will use in her store and for their farming needs. Some of the things that she intends to buy are 3 sacks of rice, cooking oil, and a sack of brown sugar. She further said that her grandchildren will also benefit from her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of rice, cooking oil, and a sack of brown sugar.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk to sell. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be animal diseases and drought. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds and medicine. Her business goal is to be a milk supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy more cows. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy animal feed and medicine

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school.  Catherine works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Catherine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dayden

texts.en:
Dayden is 52 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Dayden works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Dayden has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice and corn.

Dayden aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila de 48 años de edad vive con su hijo de 16 años edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de desayunos, almuerzos, pupusas, bebidas frías y calientes, actividad que realiza en el mercado central. Zoila desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra necesaria para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en: Zoila is 48 years old and lives with her 16 year-old son. She is a strong-willed woman who has sold breakfast, lunch, snacks, and hot and cold drinks for 25 years at the town market. Zoila wants to build a fourth bedroom in her home, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor needed to build the bedroom.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel and to pay for labor needed to build a fourth bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
To make a living, Benjamin manages his own cafeteria selling meals in their village. He earns enough from this so that he was able to provide for the needs of the family. 

With his generated revenue, his previous loans used for the business was successfully repaid. He took a new loan recently to buy raw ingredients like meat in order to prepare food for sale.

His passion is to improve his business and to provide a better living of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat in order to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 40-year-old married woman. Jocelyn is the mother of four children. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Jocelyn has gained five years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more rabbits

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. 

Susan's business goal is to open another business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more rabbits

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling ice candy in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and farming rice businesses. 

Melinda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 18 years. He describes himself as goal oriented. 

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes, plates, basins and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a local area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, plates, basins and other items. 

He hopes that in the future, he will make more profit. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes, plates, basins and other items

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages 4 years and 10 years. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. Roseline has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of  tailoring materials. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be an independent business woman. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Femie

texts.en:
Femie is 43 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like can goods, egg, milk, soap, etc.

Femie has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income as a sand and gravel retailer.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María de 59 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su nieto de 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos en un comedor del mercado central desde hace 6 años. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, además desea construir una pila para recolectar agua por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera para construir una pila y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria, 59, lives with her lifetime companion and her 14 year old grandson.  She is a hardworking woman who has been providing domestic services at a restaurant in the central market for six years.  Maria wishes to replace her home’s roof and also build a basin to collect water.  She is requesting a loan from Fusai to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, and wood to construct a basin and replace her home’s roof.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, and wood to construct a basin and replace her home’s roof.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell from her used clothing business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. Evelyn earns additional income from farming rice.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Miriel

texts.es:
Miriel es una joven estudiante de Contabilidad, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:Soy Miriel, tengo 31 años de edad, vivo en Hatillo San Cristóbal, al Sur de Republica Dominicana, nací y crecí en la misma provincia, tengo un  hermano y una hermana, no estoy casada,  soy madre soltera de dos hijas, mi padre lamentablemente falleció y mi madre se desempeña como empleada doméstica en casa de familia, el mismo trabajo que actualmente estoy desempeñando yo.
Mi deseo es estudiar contabilidad en la Universidad del Caribe (UNICARIBE) porque me permite trabajar y estudiar ya que me da la facilidad de poder tomar clases  un solo día a la semana con horario que no interfiere con mi trabajo. 						
Escogí  esta carrera porque de pequeña fue mi sueño, me encantan los números y todo los que         tiene que ver con cuentas y además gustan los negocios. 
Realmente tengo la  necesidad de solicitar  este préstamo porque mis ingresos no son suficientes  para todos los gastos económicos que abarcan  estudiar esta carrera y a la vez  sustentar a mis hijas. Si no logro conseguir este préstamo mi sueño lamentablemente no podría hacerse realidad y la educación de mis hijas también se vería afectada ya que todo el esfuerzo que hago es para que ellas no pasen por lo que yo pase  que no pude terminar mi estudios cuando tenía que terminarlos por falta de recursos económicos de parte de mis padres.
 Mis metas académicas son terminar mi carrera, hacer cursos  que  me ayuden a reforzarla y ejercerla como una gran profesional, capacitada para trabajar en las mejores empresas de mi país aportando los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Miriel is a young accounting student, and she is requesting a loan to be able to cover her education costs. This is her story: 

I’m Miriel, I am 31 years old, I live in Hatillo San Critobal, to the south of the Dominica Republic. I was born and raised in the same province, I have a brother and a sister, I’m not married, and I am a single mother of two daughters. Sadly, my father passed away, and my mother works as a domestic employer in a family house (the same work I am doing now). My wish is to study accounting at the "Universidad del Caribe" (UNICARIBE) because it allows me to work and study, as it facilitates me being able to take classes one day a week with a schedule that doesn’t interfere with my work. 

I chose this major because it was my dream when I was little. I love numbers, all the ones that have to do with accounts, and I also like business. I really have the need to request this loan because my income is not enough for all the economic costs that are required to study this major, and at the same time sustain my daughters.  If I don’t manage to obtain this loan, sadly my dream will not come true. My daughters’ education will also be affected because everything that I do is so that they don’t go through what I have: not being able to finish my education when I had to, due to lack of economic resources from my parents. 

My academic goals are to finish my major, and take classes that will help me strengthen and exercise it as a great professional, capable of working in the best companies of my country, providing the knowledge acquired.

loans.use: To cover higher education costs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married and peacefully lives at Alcala with her family. She earns income through a farming business they manage. They plant and harvest rice to sell. She also pays laborers who help them in the farming activities. 

She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 as additional revolving capital so she can ensure good growth and nutrition to crops. She will buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay laborers for farming. 

Some day, she hopes to achieve a productive harvest and earn income for her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay laborers for farming

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 16 years to 25 years. She describes herself as self committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a local area. Agnes describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as hardworking. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. Julius describes his biggest business challenge to be fuel price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to repair his motorcycle and buy another motorcycle. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle and buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Elvira de 29 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Elvira es socia del grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso” constituida por 08 personas activas y responsables. Ella se dedica a la venta de mazamorra en una plaza principal de la zona. Por temporada de frio le ha permitido tener mayor demanda. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de azúcar, maíz, canela y vasitos descartable.  Su mayor visión es contar con un negocio de prendas de vestir para caballeros y damas. El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible éste crédito. Elvira se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo,  viste polo morado y lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en:
Elvira is 29 years old; she is married with 2 children under her care. Elvira is a member of the group, “Esperanza y Progreso” (Hope and Progress), made up of 8 active and responsible members. She makes a living selling porridge in the town’s main plaza. The winter season has allowed her to have a greater demand. That is why she requested a loan to purchase sugar, corn, cinnamon, and disposable cups. Her biggest vision is to have a business selling clothes for men and women. 

The group “Esperanza y Progreso” wants to thank the Kiva lenders that made this loan possible. 

Elvira is in the back row, the second one from the left, she wears a purple polo and carries a baby in her arms.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, corn, cinnamon, and disposable cups

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from nipa roofing making. 

Gilda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional kilos of meat to sell at her butcher shop.  Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of meat to sell

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Una pequeña tienda es la que acompaña a la señora Marleny en su vida junto con su esposo, cansada de estar en su hogar sentada solo dedicada  a las labores de la casa decidió montar un negocio para tener sus propios ingresos y cada día envejece como persona normal y va necesitando más de un medio para mantenerse en vejez. 

Solicita un crédito para surtir su tienda y sobrevivir en el mercado que cada día se torna más difícil pues el empleo escasea y cada persona está optando por montar su negocio y la competencia se torna difícil. 

Con el crédito podrá surtir su negocio en grano, abarrotes, dulces, etc. ejemplos: arroz, panela, aceite, sal, frijoles, alverjas, lentejas, etc. 

Su sueño es montar un mini-mercado en la zona.
texts.en: A small store goes along with Marleny in her life with her husband.  Tired of sitting home alone and doing housework, she decided to start a business so she could have her own income.  As a normal person, aging every day, she is going to need more than one means of supporting herself in old age.  She is requesting a loan to stock her store.  Surviving in the market becomes more difficult each day because employment is scarce and, with everyone is choosing to start their businesses, competition is becoming difficult.  She will use the loan to stock her business with grain, groceries, candy, rice, “panela” [brown sugar loaves], oil, salt, beans, peas, and lentils.  Her dream is to start up a mini-market in the area.

loans.use: to stock her business with grain, groceries, candy, rice, “panela” [brown sugar loaves], oil, salt, beans, peas, and lentils.
